loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana N. is a happily married mother of four children. Her husband is a businessman who also supports the home. A lady gifted in crafts, Christiana uses locally-made materials to make beads to sell in Sapele, Delta state.  She also sells jewelry at retail prices to her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more jewelry to sell and hopes to own a world-class jewelry shop in the future. Christiana says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Gil

texts.en:
Gil D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 23 years old and married.  To make a living, Gil owns & operates a motorcycle transport services business in his local community.  Gil has been in business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Gil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gil is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide more transport services.  This loan will be his first from HSPFI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his family. 
----------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
30-year-old Jessie is married to Danny and they have one child aged 20. Jessie wants her child to have a good future, thus she works hard to realize this. She currently owns a hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field. She expects her business to prosper for her to earn more and also to augment the family’s income.

Jessie applied to CEVI and would like to loan Php 5,000. Jessie will use the loan for farm supplies like urea (a fertilizer), other fertilizers, insecticide, and other items.

loans.use: To buy urea and other fertilizers, insecticide, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Loenila

texts.en: Leonila R., 49 years old, is a farmer and also a vendor in Trento Agusan del Sur. She is doing this to support the needs of her two children. She is a tenant on a two-hectare rice field. She helps her husband manage their farm so that they will have an abundant harvest to feed their family. She dreamed of having a farm someday, so she is doing her best to be able to prosper through an improved harvest. She would like to apply for a loan of 5,000 PHP at Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: God Will Provide Group

texts.en: Mickey T. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Will Provide. He is 34 years old and married with two children who are 2 and 7 years old. He also cares for his mother and a sister. He is a high school graduate but could not continue his education through college due to poverty. For 11 years, he has been selling used clothes at the Vai town market close to downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Mickey started selling with 14,000 Liberia dollars he got from his friends. He always sells good used things and he sells them on time in order encourage customers to continue returning. Mickey plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used clothes for sale. He dreams of building a shop and becoming an importer. His goal is to educate his children and build more houses for his family. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mickey is the one holding the sign and Miatta is in the inset photo in the lower right corner. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for sale

loans.name: Dasola

texts.en: Dasola sells kerosene and VCDs at retail prices to her customers. With these combined businesses, she hopes to make her business more sustainable. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children. Her husband is a teacher and he also supports their home.  Her children are excelling in school and this gives her joy as a mother. She is requesting for a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 50 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora, tiene 6 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con su última hija y su esposo en su casa propia. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de utensilios de cocina  y lencerías en general  en un mercado informal. De esa manera su actividad de trabajo empieza desde las 8.00am hasta las 2.00pm. Por otro lado, los artefactos que también vende lo realizan por pedidos y una vez terminado de pagar por adelantado ella entrega el producto. Está contenta con lo que hace, sobre todo por la modalidad de ventas que realiza,  ya que le permite acumular  buenas utilidades. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es que  se mantiene ocupada y se distrae con sus clientes, sin embargo el tener que armar y desarmar su puesto es un trabajo pesado, ya que debe tener cuidado de no romper su mercadería como vidrios y loza. Por tal motivo desea mas adelante instalar un bazar dentro de su propio domicilio y tener la comodidad que necesita para poder vender sus productos. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. En su grupo, es una cliente responsable y puntual, asimismo  le gusta asistir a todas las reuniones de cada mes. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el incremento de sus productos, para satisfacer las exigencias de sus compradores.
texts.en:
Maria, 50 years old, is a happy and hard-working woman with 6 children, and she still lives in her own house with the last daughter and her husband. Her business is the sale of kitchen utensils and linen-goods in general in an informal (street) market. In this manner, her work begins at 8:00am and lasts until 2:00pm. She also sells items by order, to be delivered once the product is paid for. Maria is content with what she does, especially with this type of sales, since it permits her to accumulate good profits. What she likes most about her business is that she stays busy and occupied with her customers. Nonetheless, having to assemble and disassemble her stall daily is heavy work, in part because she has to take care not to damage merchandise, especially the glass or clay products. For this reason, she wants, in the future, to install a store in her own home to be able to sell her products more comfortably. This is her 6th loan with MFP, and she promises to continue making her payments according to schedule. Within her group, she is a responsible and punctual client, and she like to attend all the monthly reunions. Maria will invest this loan in increasing her products, in order to satisfy her buyers demands.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A VARIETY OF PRODUCTS TO SATISFY CUSTOMER DEMAND

loans.name: Yanny

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Yanny;  ella tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende granos secos como habas secas, maíz, morado, maíz blanco, maíz amarillo, cereales, entre otros. Ella vende en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos  y venderlos en su stand en Urubamba.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yanny is a member of the Communal Bank “Perolniyoc”. She lives in Urubamba Province, which is part of the Department of Cusco.

Yanny is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and divides her time between her household activities and running her small business. She sells dried goods such as beans, purple corn, white corn, yellow corn, grain, and other products. Yanny sells at the standard market of Urubamba. She is requesting a loan in order to buy dried goods to sell from her stand in Urubamba.

Yanny appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried goods

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Shown in the photo is Mrs. Duong R., who lives in Siem Reap Province. Duong R., age 34, sells various kinds of vegetables in Psa Kroam Market, and earns approximately $3 profit a day. Besides her current work, she also raises a few poultry at her home for extra income. She has a life partner in her husband who shares financial responsibility for his family by driving a motor taxi. He runs his business very well because he has skills in communication which he uses with his customers. However, his income is declining due to the fact that his motorcycle breaks down frequently. That is why Duong R. has decided to ask for a loan of $1,200 to replace the broken motorcycle. She achieves to use the remaining money from the loan to accrue financial capital for her vegetable business.

loans.use: To replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Mrs. Sarin N., (pictured here with her husband, Mr. Vanna Leam) is 42 years old and  lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own 4-hectares of land where they cultivate rice. Mrs. Sarin N. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, to pay for laborer to plow her farm and to buy pesticide. Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Vanna Leam is also a construction worker who is able to receive a small salary to help his family. This couple has three children, one is seamstress in a garment factory while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay for a laborer, and to buy pesticide

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha Dawaseh is a 26-year-old mother of three daughters and two sons. Her husband, Jamal, owns an electronics store where he sells new and used appliances, such as refrigerators, recorders, and microwaves. Maha's husband started the business four years ago with very little capital. The business is prospering, so Maha and her husband decided to improve the store and make a few changes.

Maha took a $1,500 loan so her husband could use it to change a few things in the store, like display equipment, wall painting, etc. 

In the photograph, Jamal stands in front of the electronics that he sells, because Maha comes from a conservative background.

loans.use: Improve her husband's electronics store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a variety of seafood

loans.name: Bolivianitas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “BOLIVIANITAS” está iniciando su tercer ciclo en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.   Este grupo consta de nueve socias,  las socias más antiguas y tienen un año en nuestra institución;  a la cabeza se encuentra la presidenta, tesorera y secretaria de actas.

La  señora Maríanela, presidenta de la asociación, comenta que fue invitada para formar parte de la asociación. Su negocio es ambulante, ella trabaja haciendo jugar “Pasanacu”, recoge todos los días un monto de dinero pequeño de sus clientes y luego cuando se reúne una cantidad considerable al término del tiempo establecido, puede ser por semana o por quincena o por mes, se entrega el dinero o víveres al ganador del sorteo y luego cada cierto tiempo el monto de dinero o víveres van rotando entre todos sus clientes.  Este trabajo le permite cuidar de su hogar y de sus cuatro hijos.

En relación al resto de los integrantes la A.C. “Bolivianitas” también tienen sus propios negocios, como ser: comercio de víveres, Internet, venta de quesos, macramé, venta de cosméticos y artefactos, artesanía, venta de comida, venta de chinelas.
texts.en:
The communal association “BOLIVIANITAS” is initiating its third cycle in the focal point of Villa Exaltación. This group consists of nine partners--the oldest partners--and has been with our institution for a year. Heading up the group are the president, treasurer, and secretary. Maríanela, president, comments that she was invited to form part of the association. Her business is mobile--she works in "Pasanacu" (the Bolivian term for person-to-person lending). Everyday she collects a small sum of money from her customers and then when a certain considerable amount is gathered at the end of a determined time--it could be per week, per two weeks, or per month--the money or provisions are delivered to the winner of the drawing. Eventually the amount of money or provisions rotates around to all her customers. This work permits her to take care of her home and her four children. As for the rest of the members of "Bolivianitas," they also have their own businesses, such as: provisions commerce, Internet, cheese sales, macrame, cosmetics sales, handicrafts, food sales, and flip flop sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Reachel

texts.en: Reachel is a married, has one child and makes a living by running a beauty salon. She has been in this line of work for eight years, and now has one employee. She gets some financial assistance from her husband, and has also received a loan from the Mwangaza group in Faulu Kenya.  She says that this loan helped her improve her standard of living by allowing her to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to open two additional salons, but for now is applying for a new loan to buy equipment, including a hair drier, camera and beauty products such as nail polish, hair chemicals and hair braids. She describes herself as friendly and outgoing.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria C. is 54 years old and has four children. She has been a widow for almost seven years. Since her husband’s death, she shoulders all the responsibility for taking care of her children and sending them to school. In 2004 she became a member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) – a partner microfinance institution of Kiva in the Philippines. From then on ASHI became her partner in providing for her family's daily needs and improving their lives. Today all of her children have college degrees and their own jobs. The family's primary source of income is selling fish, a business that Victoria started from her loan with ASHI.  

She is applying for another loan of PHP 20,000 for additional capital to buy fish from small fishermen in the community. She sells these fish in nearby municipal markets and cities. She wants to improve her business to make it more stable. By doing this, she knows that she can create jobs and help the fishermen she buys from to improve their own standards of living. She is thankful that ASHI and Kiva give her the opportunity to have access to capital and to improve her family's quality of life. She hopes that the two institutions will support her in her dream of providing employment within her community, especially to out-of-school youth.

Please ignore the date on the picture. It was not set on the camera to reflect the actual date when the picture was taken. This is the most recent picture of Victoria.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es: La Sra. Avelina es cliente desde el año 2003, trabajo en principio en grupo solidario de tres personas llamado Princesas, todas ella de la zona de Irpavi e Irpavi alto, se dedica a esta actividad de la compra y venta de material desechable desde hace más de 10 años, ella al momento tiene dos depósitos para recolectar dicho material, uno es en la zona de  Caliri y otro en zona de Irpavi, lugares donde recogen todo lo que ella reúne en dos semanas, al margen de ello, también se dedica a la venta de muebles de segunda mano, estos los comercializa en la Feria de 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mercadería tanto de material desechable, como también de muebles de segunda mano,  el esposo colabora con ella en los gastos, él se dedica a la construcción en la zona sur, tienen tres hijos bajo su cuidado, lo otros 3 se casaron o ya tienen su hogar independiente, esta señora es cliente cumplida y antigua por tal razón se solicita el financiamiento KIVA para ella.
texts.en:
Avelina has been a client since 2003.  In the beginning she worked with three women in a communal bank called “Princesas”.  All of them are from the Irpavi and Irpavi Alto area.  She has been buying and selling disposable materials for over ten years.

She currently has two depots to collect these materials.  One is in the Caliri area, and the other is in the Irpavi area.  Everything that she gets together in two weeks is gathered at the two locations.

She also sells second-hand furniture at the Feria de 16 de Julio in the city of El Alto.

She will use the money from the loan to buy disposable material and second-hand furniture.  Her husband collaborates with her on the expenses.  He does construction work in the southern zone.  They have three children under their care.  The other three are married or have their own homes.

This woman is a responsible, long-time client.  That is why a Kiva loan is being requested for her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
This is Teresa M., 56, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto M. and mother to a hard-working young adult. By the grace of God, Teresa has managed to support her child's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale price and selling at piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 13,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Teresa dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Daffodil

texts.en:
Daffodil is  38 years old and has five children, two sons and three daughters.   She lives with her family in the province of Rizal in the Philippines. 

To supply additional income for her family, Daffodil is starting a tricycle business.  A tricycle is a motorcycle with a sidecar attached, used as a public utility vehicle.

Daffodil would like to receive a loan to pay for the maintenance of it.  As a member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, Daffodil is thankful for access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams.  
 
With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her business will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.  Her long-term dreams are to continue to support her children and to build a stronger home that can withstand the flooding common in her area.

loans.use: Tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Nelsa

texts.en:
Nelsa M. is from the town of Santo Niño. She is 20 years old. Nelsa is currently pregnant with her first baby. She is not married yet but plans to settle down and have her own family. Nelsa's parents are both farmers and they gave her a parcel of land where rice crops are planted. Nelsa maintains it now and hopes to earn from it once harvest comes. She hopes to be able to sustain the farm and have a stable business. 

Nelsa still needs additional farm supplies like fertilizers. She applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP from CEVI. She said she likes the MFI's services and feels secure because of its micro-insurance program.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lkagvasuren

texts.en: Lkavgasuren is a 42-year-old single man. He lives alone in a small house which he built in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been operating a taxi business for five years.  During these years he has gained much experience. He is planning to sell his old car and purchase another second hand car, due to safety regulations for transportation. He gives the income he earns to his sister for saving. He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a second hand car.

loans.use: To purchase seccond hand car

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es: El señor José Leonel, tiene 49 años tiene 1 hijo. Rafael se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de acarreo. El dio inicio a este medio de vida porque no tenía un medio de ingreso para mantener a su familia ya que siempre ha demostrado ser un padre responsable. El tiene una camioneta en donde traslada todas las cosas que sus clientes necesitan.  El crédito que solicita es para realizar ciertas reparaciones a su camioneta. Su sueño es llegar a aumentar el mercado de oferta, esto con el propósito de incrementar las ganancias percibidas por el señor y de esta manera apoyar más a su familia económicamente.
texts.en: Mr. Jose Leonel, is 49 years old and has one son, Rafael. His work is trucking services. He began doing this work because he had no means of income to maintain his family, and he has always been a responsible parent. He has a truck in which he transports everything his clients' need. He is asking for a loan to take care of various repairs on his truck. His dream is to one day increase his market offerings and with this proposition, increase his potential earnings so that he may support even more his family economically.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Peter Njoroge

texts.en:
Peter Njoroge J. is 42 years old, married to Ruth Wanjiru, and they have four children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for over eighteen years now.

Peter was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his third loan. He cleared all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to buy two dairy cows with the loan for milk production.

In the future, Peter hopes to increase his herd and practice large-scale dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is the wife of M. A. and resides in a city called Kasur in Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeat and leather industries. She has been living there with her family for the past ten years. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her elder son is studying in class 5 and the younger one is in class 2. Her daughter is only two years of age and doesn’t attend school. 

She and her husband are both involved in a business of selling clothes. She sells clothes to her neighboring clients and also offers them alteration services. Her husband purchases clothes from the wholesale markets in the city of Lahore. He operates a shop in the market where he sells ladies' and gents' clothes at cheaper rates. 

Zahida has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for the improvement of her family business. They will utilize the loan in the purchasing of clothes in bulk, which will enable them to offer more variety to their clients and also minimizes the cost of traveling every month. They have been involved in this business for the past ten years, and Zahida is hopeful that an investment will make a positive impact on the business and that their income will be increased. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She is a responsible loan user who has paid her installments on time and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Neh

texts.en:
Neh was born in 1957 and is married and a mother of six children. Her challenges have been those of illness, marital misunderstanding, and the destruction of her property during political uproar. Her husband’s unemployment has also made it difficult to feed her family well and for her children to go to school. This led her to seek help and to become a member of GHAPE where she was trained in business management, marketing techniques and credit discipline. Since then, she has invested and repaid all her loans. She raised money to pay school fees for her children, buy a plot of land, build a house, and buy food for her family.

Given a loan of 400,000 FRS she plans to carry out the business of patching and selling tyres and engine oil together with crop cultivation.  Her son who has experience in that area will do the work and the workshop will be situated along the main road to access as many clients as possible. With this, she will raise money to continue paying her children’s school fees, buy medication and to complete her house.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: tyres and spare parts

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 30 años de edad, natural del distrito de Anco, es un  joven muy alegre y trabajador; convive con Zelmira de 24 años y tienen 02 hijos Yasmin de 05 años y Kelvin de 01 año de edad; juntos viven en su propia casa en la comunidad de Santa Rosa anexo del distrito de Anco. La labor que realiza Jorge es labrar la tierra, donde tiene plantaciones de cacao y café. Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra y gracias a ello, hoy trabaja en sus propias tierras. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo, donde lleva trabajando 10 años. En los días  de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros quienes se encargan de trasladar los productos cosechados hasta cierto tramo; para luego poder comercializarlo. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque  gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas están desarrollando, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; nos comenta además que la estación de invierno no es de su agrado porque en estos meses abundan los insectos y las lluvias son constantes así imposibilitando el rendimiento en su trabajo. Con el tiempo, espera poder comprar más tierras y variar sus plantaciones, para así darle una buena estabilidad económica a  su  familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, siente que este aporte le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo y esta dispuesto a cumplir puntualmente con sus cronogramas de pagos. Agradece a la institución Prisma por concederle el crédito. Con los  2,000 nuevos soles solicitados,  comprará semillas de cacao y cítricos.
texts.en:
Jorge, 30, is from Anco district.  He is a cheerful, hard working young man.  He cohabits with Zelmira, 24, and they have two children, Yasmin, 5, and Kelvin, 1.  They all live together in their own house in the community of Santa Rosa, an annex of Anco district.

Jorge works as a farmer; he has cocoa bean and coffee crops.  His parents taught him how to till the land and thanks to that today he has his own fields.  He is well aware of how hard field work is; he’s been doing it for 10 years.  During harvest time he hires day laborers who transport the harvested products a certain distance to be sold.  He is very committed to his job because thanks to his daily efforts today he enjoys watching his plants develop thus earning good profits.  He also tells us that he doesn’t much enjoy the winter season because insects are plentiful and rain is constant making productive work impossible.  In time, he’d like to buy more land and vary his crops to provide his family with a good economic stability.

This is his first loan with MFP and he feels it will help his business’ progress a lot and is willing to repay in a timely fashion.  He thanks Prisma for granting the loan.  He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy cocoa bean and citrus seeds.

loans.use: To buy cocoa bean and citrus seeds.

loans.name: Hannah Wanjiru

texts.en:
Hannah has practised farming in Nduyu, Njeru town for the last 18 years.  She is 56 years old, married to David Kinuthia, and they have four children. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her third loan.  She repaid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the  entire loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In future, Hannah hopes to become a leading milk producer in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Neverless

texts.en: Neverless is 37 years old, married, and has four children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been in retail for 18 years. Her hardships are debtors, price fluctuations, and high transport costs; her dreams are to become a wholesale businesswoman and educate her family. Neverless is requesting a loan to buy sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: To purchase sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor, 27, is married and lives with her husband and son in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver who conducts his taxi service business while her son attends secondary school. They live in a ger, a Mongolian traditional housing tent, in someone else's backyard. 

Dolgor operates a clothing trading business in a rented booth in Huleg trading center, one of the busiest and most crowded markest in her area. After years of stable business operation she has been able to open one more booth at another trading center called Mon-Mandal. She is very hard-working lady who possesses good communication skills. She says, "I want to buy a place where I can build a winter shelter." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy more clothes at wholesale prices and increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more clothes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vicentina; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de desayunos como quinua, maca y en las tardes vende picarones y arroz  con leche, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de desayunos, picarones y arroz con leche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los desayunos y picarones.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "The Triumphant". It is located in the district of Andahuaylillas and it belongs to the province of Quispicanchis and to the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Vicentina. She is 36 years old and she is single. She alternates her daily activities with her breakfast restaurant business, selling quinoa and maca root and in the afternoons she sells donuts and rice pudding. She sells itinirantly from 6am to 10pm. It is through this business that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her business selling breakfast foods, donuts, and rice pudding. She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to prepare her breakfast foods and donuts.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to prepare breakfast foods and donuts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase materials for weaving.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Asunta;  La socia tiene 44 años de edad; La socia es casada;  La socia  tiene 4 hijos varones y 1 mujer; La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su negocio la socia tiene una picantería (tienda en la que se expende diferentes tipos de platillos, están desde los tradicionales platos tres en uno, hasta los choclos con queso y ensalada; lo peculiar de estas picanterías es que en ellas se puede probar las bebidas hechas a base de maíz y fresas, llamadas frutilladas); la socia en esta ocasión desea implementar su picantería desde la compra de más servicios como platos se segundos, vasos para las bebidas los famosos caporales que son vasos grandes y anchos una réplica de los keros, los vasos de los inkas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de servicios para el negocio.  

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “MADRES TRABAJADORAS” [Working Mothers] community bank. This bank is located in the district of Tica Tica, province of Cuzco, departament of Cuzco.

This member is named Asunta. She is 44 years old, married and has 4 sons and 1 daughter. She alternates her activities between the home and attending to her business. She has a picantería, a store that sells different types of small dishes, from traditional thre in one dishes, to corn with cheese and salad. What is particular about these picanterías is that you can try beverages made from corn and strawberries, called frutilladas. Asunta decided to outfit her picantería at this time. She will buy materials such as plates, glasses for the beverages called "caporales", which are large, thick glasses that are a replica of the "keros", the glasses the Incas used. She will use the loan to buy these materials.   

Asunta is satisfied with the loan and is committed to making the payment according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for her business

loans.name: Rojica

texts.en:
Rojica is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is only 6 years old. Rojica is engaged in farming and hog-raising businesses. She grows rice, and her harvest is for selling and family consumption. Rojica also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs to sell at the market. 

Rojica's loan will be used to buy piglets, feeds and fertilizers. She will also pay rent for the tractor she used in tilling her land.

In the future, Rojica hopes to have a prosperous business. She also hopes to see all her children succeed.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and fertilizers and to pay rent for the tractor

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es: Flor de María de 23 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida de 22 años y con su pequeña hija en casa familiar.  Flor se dedica a la venta de pan, desde hace 7 años que posee una pequeña panadería en la cual trabaja junto con su compañero de vida. Desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana Flor empieza el día y lo primero que hace es el rico pan que más tarde pone a la venta.  Gracias a su carisma y amabilidad se ha ganado la confianza de los vecinos y estos están satisfechos tanto con el servicio como con el rico pan que Flor ofrece. Últimamente ha notado que la cantidad de pan que hace no le alcanza para cubrir toda la demanda. Ya que es una mujer emprendedora no quiere dejar pasar esta oportunidad y ha decidido aumentar la producción para esto necesita la ayuda de un préstamo, es por esta razón que se decidió en solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL  para comprar una cantidad mayor de material como harina, azúcar, aceite y de mas materiales necesarios para llevar acabo la producción del delicioso pan. Le pide a Dios que esta decisión le ayude a mejor su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Flor de María is 23 years old.  She lives with her 22 year old life partner and their little daughter in the family home.  Flor sells bread, and she has had a small bakery for seven years.  She works there with her life partner.  Flor starts in the very early hours of the morning.  The first thing she does is make the delicious bread that she will later sell.

Thanks to her charisma and kindness, she has won her neighbors' confidence.  They are satisfied with the service as much as with the delicious bread that Flor sells.  She has noticed that lately the quantity of bread that she makes does not cover all of the demand.

As an enterprising woman she does not want to let this opportunity pass.  She has decided to increase her production.  To do so she needs the help of a loan.  That is the reason she decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL.  The loan is to buy a greater quantity of ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, and the rest of the ingredients she needs to make her delicious bread.  She asks God that this decision will help her improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, and the rest of the ingredients she needs to make her delicious bread.

loans.name: Jabal

texts.en:
Jabal is 30 years old.  He is married and has two children between 2 and 7 years old.  He also has five adopted children between 2 and 20 years old. Jabal makes a living as the owner of a beans and Irish potatoes store. His business is well organized.  Jabal has seven years of experience in his business and works from 6am until 5:30pm every day except on Saturday.

Jabal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company S.A. in order to purchase more beans and Irish potatoes to sell. He hopes to increase the number of his customers as well as his profits. If successful, Jabal will save for the future and satisfy his family's needs.

loans.use: buy beans and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DE LOS ANGELES DE URQUILLOS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Urquillos en la Provincia de Calca y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidia; la socia tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 4 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista ella compra cada tres días verduras de una proveedora, la socia compra zanahorias, tomate, cebollas,lechugas, y todo tipo de hortalizas, la socia vende en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia también tiene un pequeño huerto en casa y tiene un terreno de cultivo de maíz blanco. La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de verduras a la socia le dejan al crédito para pagar mensualmente de las verduras entonces ella pagara su crédito y de este modo tendrá la posibilidad de que le vuelvan a fiar, la socia también invertirá en la compra de maíz blanco como semilla para la nueva siembra. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz blanco y pagar de las verduras, para que le den otro grupo de diversas verduras también. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de verduras y de maíz blanco.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Reyna de los Angeles de Urquillos” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Urquillos, in the province of Calca, in the department of Cusco.

The member is Lidia. She is 44 years old, married, and has 4 children. She buys and sells vegetables. She works in re-sale. She buys vegetables every third day from a distributor. She buys carrots, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, and all kinds of vegetables. She sells them in the market in Urubamba. She also has a small garden at her house and she has a piece of land where she grows white corn. She would like a loan to buy vegetables. The distributor lets her use credit to pay for her vegetables each month. This way she can pay that loan so that they might lend to her again. She will also buy white corn seed for the new planting season. She is requesting the loan to buy the seed for planting white corn and to pay off the vegetables. She will invest in vegetable purchase and white corn seeds.

Lidia is grateful for the support she is being granted and she also promises to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of vegetables and white corn seed for planting

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 60-year-old divorced woman who has started a small retail business at home selling clothes. She started her business to support her by having a good basic monthly income to help her pay her home rental fees. Now Najah has been in the business for four years and is happy that she became one of the productive hard working women in society. That’s why she decided to expand her business and open her own store in the future. In order to do that, Najah has applied for this loan to increase her capital base, which will allow her to buy a more fashionable collection of clothes.

loans.use: To buy more fashionable collections of clothes to sell

loans.name: Andres De Jesus

texts.es:
Andrés, de 57 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Estelí, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de lubricantes, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Cuando el empezó en esta actividad lo hizo atravez de un crédito pues no contaba con capital propio, antes de vender lubricante el trabajaba como transportista y era comerciante al mismo tiempo, vendía granos básicos, pero decidió retirarse pues no le producía mucha rentabilidad y sus ganancia eran muy pocas, fue entonces que decidió vender lubricantes, atravez del cual ah tenido mejores ganancias que en sus negocios anteriores.      
Requiere el préstamo para comprar lubricantes. Con esta inversión piensa mantener su inventario surtido y variado de todo tipo de lubricantes que demanden sus clientes, el considera que el lugar de venta donde esta ubicado su negocio es un buen punto de venta, pero lo que necesita es mas producto que ofrecer para no perder clientes, desea mejorar su local ampliarlo mas, mejorar el nivel de sus ventas. Su meta próxima es preparar a sus hijos con una carrera profesional para que ellos sean  alguien en la vida y sean independientes.
texts.en:
Andrés is 57 years old and resides in the city of Estelí. He is married with five children and he is a merchant who sells lubricants. He has been in this business for seven years and started it through a loan, as he did not have his own capital. Prior to selling lubricant, he worked simultaneously in transportation and as a merchant selling basic grains. However, he decided to leave that business since it wasn’t very profitable and his earnings were very low. As a result, he decided to sell lubricants and has had better earnings than with his previous businesses.

He is requesting the loan to purchase lubricants. With this investment, he plans to keep his inventory stocked with all types of lubricants his customers demand. He considers the location of his place of business to be good for sales. However, he needs more products to sell so that he does not lose customers. He wants to improve his place of business, expand it, and improve his sales. His next goal is to provide his children with a professional education so that they will be someone in life and will be independent.

loans.use: to buy lubricants.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Rochelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, & beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks. 

Rochelle is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rochelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Felister

texts.en: Felister is a hardworking businesswoman aged 61. She is married and blessed with nine children. For the last 12 years, she has been operating a business selling water to make a living. She also raises pigs for more income. She has employed three people to help her to operate the business. In the next five years, she wants to add more tanks. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy water tanks.

loans.use: To buy tanks of water

loans.name: 7 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Ngát is 51 years old and married with three dependent children. She is the group leader of the 7 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.
Mrs Ngát operates a food stall selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. In 2010, Ngát joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ngát has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
The main hardship that Ngát faces in her business is lack of capital. With her business profits, Ngát hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Wekhuyera Netundo Group

texts.en:
Richard is the facilitator of the Wekhuyera Netundo group. Richard and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Richard and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

Richard takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and to grow enough to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Richard had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on one ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Richard was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one ½ acre of land. 

With income from maize sales, Richard will invest in livestock rearing and save for the future. 

In 2012, the members of Wekhuyera Netundo group will each plant between ½ and one acres of maize. 

In the photograph above, Richard is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира жительница города Куляб. Ей 32 года. У нее двое детей. Она одна воспитывает своих детей. Образование у нее среднее. Она шесть лет как занимается торговлей. Замира арендует торговую точку на рынке, где продает детскую одежду. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент своего товара. Поэтому берет кредит для покупки детских шапок, теплых костюмчиков, футболок и еще осеней обуви.
texts.en: Zamira lives in the town of Kulob.  She is 32 years old and has two children, whom she is raising by herself.  She has a secondary education.  Zamira has been involved in retails sales for six years.  She leases a retail outlet at the market, where she sells children's clothing.  She wants to expand the assortment of her merchandise.  This is why Zamira is requesting a loan to buy children's hats, warm suits, tea-shirts and also autumn shoes.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.ru: Асад женат имеет двоих детей. На содержание семьи он использует свою выручку и доходы от бизнеса. Его бизнес - это откорм и продажа крупного рогатого скота. А также он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Асад хочет получить хорошую прибыль для того чтобы лечить свою дочь. Его дочь инвалидка и она нуждается в помощь своего отца. Он запрашивает займ для покупки 3 голов быка с целью расширения бизнеса и получение прибыли для лечения своей дочки. Он заранее благодарен всех вас за вашу помощь и милосердие.
texts.en: Asad is married and has two children.  He uses his profits and income from the business to support his family.  His business is fattening up and sales of cattle.  Asad is also involved in growing agricultural crops.  He wants to make a good profit in order to provide medical care for his daughter, who is disabled and needs her father's help.  He is requesting a loan for the purchase of three heads of bulls in order to expand his business and make a profit to care for his daughter.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and mercy.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dunia Rosibel

texts.es:
La  señora Dunia  tiene 22 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 3 años, vive en  la Colonia Flor del Campo, Municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.
Posee un negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como frijoles, maíz, arroz,  manteca, harina de trigo y de maíz, salsas, huevos y golosinas.

Ella solicito un crédito para poder abastecer su negocio y ofrecerle productos de calidad a sus clientes y a la vez mejorar el volumen de ventas y aumentar las ganancias.
Una parte de los ingresos que ella obtiene, los destina para la alimentación y demás necesidades de su familia, la otra parte la ahorra con el propósito de proveerle una buena educación a su hijo en el futuro.

Doña Dunia es optimista con el crecimiento de su negocio, sus clientes son permanentes y prefieren su negocio debido a la buena calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Dunia is 22 years old.  She is a single mother, and she has a three year old son.  She lives in the Flor del Campo neighborhood in the Azacualpa municipality, Santa Bárbara.

She has a grocery store business where she sells staple goods like beans, corn, rice, lard, wheat and corn flour, salsas, eggs, and sweets.

She requested a loan to be able to stock her business and offer her customers quality products.  At the same time she will improve the volume of sales and increase her income.  Part of the income that she gets is for food and other family necessities.  The other part is to save to provide a good education for her son in the future.

Dunia is optimistic about the growth of her business.  She has fixed customers, and they prefer her business due to the good quality of her products.

loans.use: to buy staples.

loans.name: Marianne Frence

texts.en:
Marianne Frence is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Marianne Frence has a karaoke shop that provides videoke where customers pays 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to pay for the electricity for the karaoke services.

Marianne Frence has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marianne Frence hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity for the karaoke services.

loans.name: Demba

texts.fr:
DEMBA HABITE DANS UN DÉPARTEMENT DE LA RÉGION SUD DU SÉNÉGAL .AGE DE 46 ANS MARIE D'UNE FEMME ,IL A 4 ENFANTS QUI SONT TOUS A L'ÉCOLE FRANÇAISE . L'AINE EST EN CLASSE DE TERMINALE LE DEUXIÈME FAIT LA TROISIÈME SECONDAIRE ET LES DEUX AUTRES SONT EN PRIMAIRE 
DEMBA EST DANS LE COMMERCE DEPUIS 1997 , IL FAIT SES ACHATS A TOUBA MOURIDE UN MARCHE HEBDOMADAIRE ,C'EST AVEC CE MÉTIER QU'IL SUPPORTE LES CHARGES DE LA FAMILLE ET LES FRAIS SCOLAIRE DES ENFANTS .
DEMBA SOUHAITE DANS L'AVENIR AVOIR UNE MAISON ET SE DÉBARRASSER DE LA LOCATION .
texts.en:
DEMBA LIVES IN A DEPARTMENT IN THE SOUTH OF SENEGAL. HE IS 46 YEARS OLD, MARRIED AND HAS FOUR CHILDREN WHO ATTEND THE FRENCH SCHOOL. THE OLDEST IS IN HIS LAST YEAR OF SCHOOL, THE SECOND OLDEST IS IN HIS THIRD YEAR OF HIGH SCHOOL AND THE TWO YOUNGEST ARE IN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL.

DEMBA HAS BEEN IN BUSINESS SINCE 1997. HE PURCHASES HIS INVENTORY AT TOUBA MOURIDE, A WEEKLY MARKET. WITH THE BUSINESS, HE HAS BEEN ABLE TO SUPPORT HIS FAMILY AND TAKE CARE OF HIS CHILDREN'S SCHOOL EXPENSES.
DEMBA HOPES IN THE FUTURE TO BUY A HOUSE SO HE NO LONGER HAS TO RENT.

loans.use: to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is 42 years old and a mother of a son and a daughter. Both of her children are getting their education. In order to afford their education, Bilqees sews clothes for her community clients. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her brother, who also lives with her family and drives a tractor.   He provides loading services to his customers.  With the loan investment, he will buy new tires, because his tractor’s current tires have become rough and need replacement. By purchasing new tires, he will be able to run his tractor more smoothly and provide better quality services to his customers for better profits.
He has been operating his business for the past many years and Bilqees is confident that he will get more success in his business after the loan investment.
Note: "In the photo, the lady holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bilqees."

loans.use: To buy tractor tires for loading business

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es: La señora Diana a sus 23 años de edad es madre de dos hijos, uno de ellos tiene dos años y el otro esta recién nacido con 5 meses de edad.  La señora Diana es una emprendedora quien desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de mercancía principalmente ropa interior para dama, esta labor la realizara en paralelo con su empleo de operaria de confección. La señora Diana requiere de la compra de surtido para iniciar su negocio y suplir la demanda de fin de año. Con lo anterior, podrá mejorar sus ingresos y así apoyar económicamente a su esposo con los gastos familiares. El sueño de la señora Diana es ver crecer a sus hijos y brindarles una excelente educación.
texts.en:
Diana, at 23 years old, is the mother of two children. One of them is two years old and the other one is a new-born, five months old. Diana is an enterprising woman who hopes to start her own business selling merchandise - mainly women's underwear - which she will do in parallel with her job as a textile worker.

Diana needs to purchase inventory to start her business and meet the end-of-year demand. With this business she hopes to improve her income and therefore economically help her husband with family expenses. Her dream is to see her children grow up and provide them with an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as underwear.

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is taking another Kiva loan of KES 100,000 to boost her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of blouses, suits and Kikois (cotton fabric) for sale. With the additional income from the business, she intends to renovate her house and provide better education for her children. 

Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for providing her with financial services.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Faosuly

texts.es: Ella es Faisuly, quiere retomar su historia y contar que con la ayuda culmino el primer semestre de clases, ahora iniciara prácticas para poner a prueba todo lo que aprendió, el entusiasmo la cautiva ya que manejara pacientes, vera casos extraordinarios donde probablemente será de mucha utilidad la ayuda, este semestre las cosas fueron un poco más complicadas para ella, ya que la relación con las compañeras de clase se deterioró un poco, hubo momentos cruciales de trasnocho, siempre ha tenido muchas ganas de salir adelante, esas ganas hacen que ella sea más fuerte y cada día se levanta pensando en el momento en que reciba el diploma de grado y diga que pudo llegar muy alto, porque esto no termina acá, por que para ella la lectura como el estudio es la motivación para aprender y actualizarse día a día, ella agradece a kiva por el apoyo en estos semestres pasados y quiere que para este próximo sea renovado y aprobado para poder continuar y cumplir esta gran meta.

loans.use: Para pagar un semestre de matricula

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, a 55 years old store owner from Quezon, City Philippines and a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). Lolita is managing a sari-sari store business since Filipinos prefer to buy goods in a place that’s near to their homes rather than waste it for fares by going to markets. Basically, sari-sari stores can be found in every Barrios, Barangays, Municipalities and Cities where it has grills or screens as a protection against theft. Products here are measured by volumes, kilos or by piece.

She is running the business for 3 years already and this really helped her sustain the needs of her family. The profit that supposed to be a revolving fund for the business are being used for their daily needs instead. To have complete grocery items for he variety store is what she aims.

Lolita applied for Php 15, 000 loan to buy stocks like bottled drinks, variety of grocery items, school supplies and other products to add for her variety store business.

Lolita believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and  hear God’s word that  was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To buy stocks like bottled drinks, variety of grocery items, school supplies and other products to add for the business.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en: Vicente owns a shop in his house where he sells shoes and other sports equipments. He and his wife manage the store while taking care of their only son. He is in need of capital in order to be able to access better and more attractive styles for his client base. He will use the capital to try out different vendors of apparel and purchase products at higher quantities.

loans.use: increase inventory

loans.name: Akou Philomène

texts.en:
Akou Philomène A. is married and the mother of three, and she is also the guardian of two children from her deceased sister. In order to help support the household, she has devoted much of her energy to her business selling plastic kitchen items. This is a high growth sector of the market but demands a fair amount of financing. Lacking the means, Ms. A. has not been able to keep up with market trends. Thanks to her keen sense of management, she was able to repay all her previous loans without a problem. She is now requesting a new loan of $850 as capital to stock up on new plastic kitchen items, thus expanding the range of goods she offers. This will allow her to have substantial revenues for improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame A. Akou Philomène est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants et a à sa charge deux (2) enfants de sa sœur décédée. Afin de contribuer aux charges du ménage, elle s’investit beaucoup dans son commerce de vente des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique. C’est un secteur qui est très porteur mais qui demande assez de financement. Ce qui fait que Madame A. Akou Philomène n’a pas la capacité de suivre le rythme des nouveautés. Grâce à son sens aigu de gestion, elle a su rembourser tous les crédits qu’elle a obtenus sans aucun incident. Aujourd’hui, elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $850 qui va lui servir de fonds de commerce pour s’approvisionner en de nouveaux ustensiles de cuisine en plastique afin d’agrandir son étalage. Ceci lui permettra de disposer d’un revenu consistant en vue de l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire and sell plastic kitchen items

loans.name: Amenzee

texts.en: Mrs. Amenzee I. is a 46 years old woman who has five (5) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is a fashion designer. She solicits for the above amount to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve on her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy meat and fish for soup

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia works doing all kinds of sewing (skirts, comforters, vests, sweatshirts, jackets, and all kinds of fabric articles). Her home and workshop are located in the Rio Seco neighborhood, 6 de Agosto area of the city of El Alto. She is separated from her husband and is the only one who is supporting her family with this sewing work.

This is the sixth time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO. The requested amount will be destined for the purchase of a sewing machine. The one she uses now is too old and is causing many problems.

Her work allows approval of this loan, since she already has experience with sewing. The five previous loans have been repaid in full on the established schedule. Her cash flow shows sufficient income to cover the loan and also her personal necessities.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Lidia realiza todo trabajo de costura (Polleras, edredones, chalecos, buzos, chamarras y toda prenda de tela) Su domicilio y Taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Rio Seco, villa 6 de agosto de la ciudad de El Alto; esta separada de su esposo y la única que mantiene a su familia es ella con el trabajo de costura.

Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de una maquina de coser ya que la maquina de coser que actualmente usa es demasiado vieja y esta causando muchos problemas.

Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en costura. Los cinco créditos anteriores han sido pagados en su totalidad y en los plazos establecidos. El flujo de caja muestra ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y también sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her onion business

loans.name: Tafiga

texts.en:
Tafiga is a 27-year-old married mother with 3 children (aged 5, 4, and 2). When Tafiga got married she decided to move out of her parents’ house, but unfortunately they were very poor and could not afford living on their own. They moved in with her husband’s family, who owned a farm. Tafiga decided to join SPBD so they could can develop the farm and earn more money.

Through years of struggling they have managed to improve many things in her home and increase the size of their farm. Just recently her husband bought a second-hand taxi which has really helped in earning additional income. Tafiga is very thankful for the support SPBD has given her, which has helped to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy tools and supplies for her farm

loans.name: Phum

texts.en: Mrs. Phum E., 58, is a widow and lives with her four children in a part of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She stays at home cooking food for her children, while one of them works moving earth bought from the people in his arE. and resold for a good profit, earning  about $8/day in revenue. Another one of whom is employed at a factory making $2 each day and the rest of them are unemployed. Mrs. Phum E. hopes to use this loan to purchase a loading tractor for her son so that it will make his business of transportation much further faster and easier. (Her son is pictured with the loading tractor he plans to use for his business.)

loans.use: To purchase a loading tractor to assist in moving earth.

loans.name: Tang

texts.en:
Mrs. Tang S. is thirty-one years old and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works on her plot of land, breeding pigs and growing cashew nuts, making on average around $7 each day in revenue. Her husband meanwhile works as a horse-cart driver, transporting passengers, and can earn about $6 each day.

Mrs. Tang S. has two children. One of them is enrolled in school and the rest are still too young to go to school. She hopes to use this loan to purchase a large quantity of cashew nuts from the growers and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase cashew nuts in bulk from the growers

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 30 year old divorced woman with a six-year-old child. Lucy owns a food vending store that she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $45 from her sales.

In the past, Lucy has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is Tatu C.. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 4 and 22 years old. In 2005, Tatu established her general store business. Working six days a week, and 9 to 12 hours per day, she earns about $170 each month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Tatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now seeks a new loan in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. In the future, Tatu plans to increase the quantity and range of her stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services.

Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her.

.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Jesus Del Pilar

texts.es:
Jesus belongs to the community bank Mujeres Creativas 2, located at Jr. Tiwinsa Mz. D Lt. 6, in the district of Manaytay in the city of Ucayali. She is 28 years old is a mother of 3 children, her husband is a teacher. Jesus used the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos totalling S/.300 to invest in the sales of soft drinks.

Today she continues selling soft drinks and she also sells prepared foods. In the mornings she manages the household chores and at in the evenings she manages her small business while helping her children with their homework.

With the loan she recevies totalling S/.800, which will be repaid in a term of 4 months, she will purchase: soft drinks, food ingredients, and snacks to offer more variety to her clients.

Jesus is very happy with the results she has seen and and also because she feels more economically stable.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Jesús pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Creativas 2, ubicado en el Jr. Tiwinsa Mz. D Lt. 6, del Distrito de Manaytay del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es profesor, Jesús con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta de gaseosas. En la actualidad continua con su venta de gaseosas y también se dedica a la venta de comidas, por las mañanas se dedica a las labores domesticas de su hogar así mismo atiende su negocio y por las noches ayuda a sus hijos con sus tareas escolares. Con este préstamo recibido de S/.800 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: gaseosas de diferentes precios, víveres para la venta de sus comidas, golosinas para ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes. Jesús se siente muy feliz por los resultados que tiene y además por que se siente mas independiente económicamente.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase ingredients for the preparation of her foods.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Mrs. Justina belongs to the Communal Bank of Virgen de la Natividad, located at Jr. Gonzales Prada 155 in the District of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 57 years old, separated, and a mother of 4 children. With the first loan received from Manuela Ramos for 300 soles, she decided to invest in a small tailoring shop. Currently she divides her time between her household duties and her work sewing clothing ordered by her customers. Given the quality of her work, she enjoys much appreciation from her clients. With this new loan, which will be paid within 4 months, she will purchase a variety of fabrics, wood and other materials to fix up her shop. Justina feels very satisfied working every day to improve her standard of living. Her children support her in everything and are very proud that their mother has decided to create her own business and work hard to progress forward in her life.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

La señora Justina pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen de la Natividad, ubicado en el Jr. Gonzáles Prada 155, D. Distrito de Calleria D. Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 57 años y es madre de 4 hijos, es separada. Justina con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en un pequeño taller de costura. En la actualidad comparte sus tareas domesticas con la confección de sus prendas que le solicitan sus clientes, por el buen trazo y acabado de sus prendas, goza de mucha aceptación. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará: telas de diferentes colores, clavos, madera para el arreglo de su taller. Justina se siente muy tranquila trabajando todos los días para salir adelante, sus hijos la apoyan en todo, y se sienten muy orgullosos de su madre que decidió poner su negocio y trabajar para progresar.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and other goods for her business

loans.name: Vien Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Vien, 24 years old, joined the Fund in 2004. Her family lives near the ocean so their primary source of income is from fishing. Although the fishing profession is unpredictable, their income is still high. In the first rounds of funding the family used the loan to invest in fishing equipment, and since it was and is their biggest source of income, the investments have brought many favorable changes to the family. Besides the fishing business, the family also works the fields and participates in livestock raising cooperatives. The couple has one small child. In this round of funding Mrs. Vien is requesting 6,000,000 VND to invest in more fishing equipment. Their average income is 3,500,000 VND a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Viên Thị Tuấn 24 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2004, gia đình chị sống gần biển nên nguồn thu nhâp chính của gia đình chị là làm nghề đánh cá, tuy nghề đánh cá vất vả nhưng thu nhập cũng cao, các vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đầu tư vào mua sắm đồ nghề đánh bắt cá, anh chị sinh được 1 con hiện cháu đang còn nhỏ, ngoài công việc đánh cá gia đình chị vẫn làm ruộng và kệt hợp cùng chăn nuôi, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư nhiều vào nghề đánh bắt cá từ đó công việc đánh bắt cá cũng là nguồn thu nhập lớn nhất của gia đình chị, với nguồn thu nhập hàng ngày gia đình chị đã có nhiều thay đổi. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua sắm dụng cụ đánh bắt cá. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Buy fishing equipment.

loans.name: Mastura

texts.ru:
Mastura U. lives in the Fayzabad District. She works in a department store, where she has her own sales counter. She sells shoes, children's and women's clothing. She has already been in this business for 26 years. She wants to increase her sales turnover and by doing that diversify the variety of goods she sells. Additionally, the school shopping season is coming, and she would like to bring in goods before it starts. To do this she decided to take out a 15-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Юсупова Мастура проживает в районе Файзабад. Работает в Универмаге. Имеет свой прилавок . где продает обувь, детскую и женскую одежду. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 26 лет. Хочет увеличить товарооборт и таким образом разнообразить ассортимент товара. К тому же наступил сезон школьной ярмарке и к ее началу хочет завести товар. Для этого она планируетполучить кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys is a member of the Community Bank Solución (Solution). Gladys travels to the markets of the region three times each week to the district of Vinchos. Gladys sells groceries, writing utilities, hardware, among other products that are in demand from her clients. Additionally, Gladys opened a sales shop on a school campus for scholastic goods, which is located on a street near the central market of the city of Ayacucho. Gladys also has two cars; with one of them she works for a business and with the other she does urban transportation.

Gladys needs a loan of 1000 Soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of light bulbs, lanterns, light cables, and switches.

The dreams of Gladys are to construct a second level on her house, have a shop in her home, and see her children finish their studies.

First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=22117&_tpos=11&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Primer prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=22117&_tpos=11&_tpg=1

Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Solución. Gladys es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Gladys viaja a las ferias de la región 3 veces por semana al distrito de Vinchos, Gladys vende abarrotes, útiles de escritorio, artículos de ferretería, entre otros productos que demanden sus clientes. Además Gladys en campaña escolar apertura una tienda de venta de útiles escolares que se ubica en una calle cercana al mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Gladys también tiene dos carros donde uno de ellos trabaja para una empresa y la otra realiza transporte urbano.

Gladys necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de focos, linterna, cable de luz, interruptores. Los sueños de Gladys son construir el segundo nivel de su casa, tener una tienda en su casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.

loans.use: Gladys needs a loan of 1000 Soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of light bulbs, lanterns, light cables, and switches.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 58 años D. edad estudió hasta segundo año D. primaria, es casada, madre D. un hijo y vive en la comunidad D. Machacmarca.

Hace 02 años es socia del Banco Comunal Ciudad Nueva, Machacmarca, Distrito  D. Pilcuyo, Provincia del Collao , el primer crédito que obtuvo D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles incrementó al capital que ella tenía y compró 01 vacuno con S/. 800.00 Nuevos Soles desD. que era soltera, siempre le gustó hacer negocio, empezó vendiendo gaseosas, desD. que tuvo su pareja empezó con el negocio D. compra y venta D. ganado vacuno en las ferias D. Pilcuyo, Acora, Ilave, López, Huapaca San Miguel.

Con este crédito D. S/. 2,500.00 Nuevos Soles, que pagará en 04 cuotas comprará 02 toros uno con S/. 1,600.00 Nuevos Soles y el otro con S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, los cuales serán comercializados en las ferias ya mencionadas.

Su visión es ampliar su cobertizo para  albergar más ganado vacuno.
texts.en:
Martina is 58 years old, studied until the second graD., is married and the mother of one son and lives in the Machacmarca community. She has been a member of the Ciudad Nueva community bank for two years, which is loacated in the city of Machacmarca, Pilcuyo District, Collao Province. The first loan that she obtained, of 300 Nuevo Soles, was used to increase her capital to purchase one bull costing 800 Nuevo Soles. Since she was single she has liked engaging in business. She started selling sodas and after marrying she started her business of buying and selling cattle in markets of Pilcuyo, Acora, Llave, López, Huapaca, and San Miguel. With this loan of 2,500 Nuevo Soles, which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy 2 bulls, one costing 1,600 Nuevo Soles and the other 1,200 Nuevo Soles, which will be sold in the aforementioned markets. Her vision is to enlarge her shed to store more cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en: Mrs. Sophy S., 35, and her husband, Mr. Mo Bou, 36, live along national road number one about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have three children; one son and two daughters. All of their children study in local school. Sophy is operating grocery store at her home. She bought all of the grocery items from Korky market to resell to the villagers. Her husband is in the army. Sophy is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more grocery items for resale and for her stock.

loans.use: Sophy would like to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Gneleni (Veut Dire Bravoure) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Gneleni (du nom d’une femme battante dans la légende bambara au Mali) est composé des six femmes ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 5 enfants qui vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec leur mari, des coépouses, des frères et sœurs, les enfants et autres parents dans la ville de la sous-préfecture de Fana (région de Koulikoro République du Mali). Liées par des relations de travail et de voisinage ces femmes font exclusivement le commerce de pagnes wax (tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest).
Dans le souci de satisfaire une clientèle de plus en plus croissante elles ont intégrés l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt de groupe (prêt solidaire), et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
 Elles comptent payer 300 pièces wax à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes.
