Ces pièces de pagnes wax seront découpées en trois pagnes pour être revendus en détail, au comptant et à crédit dans les marchés de Fana, Konobougou, Dioïla, Massigui etc à une clientèle constituée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice de 45.000 FCFA chacune et qu’elles utiliseront pour renforcer leurs fonds de commerce. Elles ambitionnent devenir des grossistes et nouer des relations avec une usine Hollandaise de fabrique de wax.
texts.en:
The group Gneleni (from the name of a woman fighter in the Bambara legend in Mali) is composed of six women who average 37 years of age and five children. They live in traditional extended families with their husband, co-wives, brothers, sisters, children and other parents in the city of the sub-prefecture Fana (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). Linked by ties of work and community, these women do commerce exclusively in 'Wax' pagnes (highly prized cloth in West Africa). Concerned about satifying a burgeoning customer base, the women have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their eighth group loan (solidarity loan). All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. They intend to pay for 300 lengths of pagnes in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. These lengths of cloth will be cut into three and resold retail, cash or credit accepted, in the marketplaces of Fana, Konobougou, Dioïla, Massigui, etc. to customers essentially composed of women. They each envision realizing a profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which will be used to boost their working capital. Their ambition is to become wholesalers and to establish a relationship with a Dutch factory that makes 'Wax' pagnes.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Wax pagnes

loans.name: Sophear

texts.en: Mrs. Sophear C. is a villager in Prey Mei Khang Thboung village in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a dessert seller. Her husband, Mr. Phin Sophorn, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, he faces some problems because he does not have enough money to buy rice seed and pay for plowing the field. Mrs. Sophear C. decided to ask for a loan for these purposes and, with the rest of money, to buy fertilizer and pesticides to kill insects. She is 41 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and pay for plowing a field.

loans.name: Edwing Antonio

texts.es: El Sr. Edwing tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el   barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, estado civil casado su esposa es docente de primaria, tiene dos hijos de 17 y 19 años de edad, Sus planes para con la familia es asegurarle un mejor provenir. Don Edwing tiene su pequeño negocio de trasporte selecto el cual genera sus ingresos desde hace tres años de ofrecerle a su clientela un viaje cómodo y seguro, sus metas que tiene a corto plazo es aumentar sus ingresos mediante la compra de nueva unidad de transporte. Con la solicitud del préstamo de Afodenic lograra hacer mantenimiento  a la unidad de taxi como: cambio de motor, cambio de tijeras y pintura, adquiriendo mejor presentación y capacidad de trabajo para dar un buen servicio a los clientes, como ganar más dinero.
texts.en:
Edwing is 36 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of Managua. He is in a civil union and his wife is a primary school teacher. He has two children, ages 17 and 19. He wants to provide a better future for his family.

For three years, Edwing has earned his living from a small taxi business, and he is proud to offer his clients safe and comfortable transportation. His short-term goal is to increase his earnings by purchasing a new taxi.

With this loan from Kiva's partner AFODENIC, he will perform maintenance on and make improvements to his taxi, including repainting, changing the motor, and buying a new jack. His taxi with therefore look and perform better and he will be able to provide better service to his customers and earn greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase parts to maintain taxi

loans.name: Adjata

texts.fr:
Madame Adjata B. a 52 ans, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants (2 garçons et 2 filles) dans la grande famille traditionnelle à Fama, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Adjata B.  après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée à la fabrique des savons traditionnels (savons noirs) il y a maintenant quatre (04) ans qu’elle a appris auprès d’une voisine. Elle mène son activité dans son domicile de Sikasso où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clienèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de joindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant un (1) ans. Elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 4 fuits  des déchets d’huile de coton (pates noires) et 2 sacs de soude caustique. Après fabrication des savons à base de déchets d’huile de coton et de soude caustique, elle les revend en détail à une clientèe composée généralement des femmes de sa localité..
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Adjata B., age 52, resides with her husband and their children (two boys and two girls) in a large traditional family in Fama, Sikasso's downtown (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having done many kinds of work unsuccessfully, she got started in making traditional soaps (black soaps) four years ago with a neighbor who taught her. She works at home in Sikasso, where she is in high demand by her customers because of the quality of her products.

To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago and is on her second individual loan. The preceding loan has been correctly repaid. She plans to use this loan to buy four barrels of waste cotton oil (black paste) and two sacks of caustic soda. After making the soaps from the waste cotton oil and caustic soda, she sells them retail to customers composed generally of the women of her town.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially for helping to cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest in her work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy waste cotton oil and caustic soda

loans.name: Sheema Gulzar Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Sheema baji, 43, is married and has lived in Pakpattan, Pakistan for eight years. Pakpattan is famous for its shrines. People used to come to this city to visit these shrines. Sheema baji's husband is G. A.. He is a wholesaler by profession. He buys different items wholesale and sells to different places and shops. They have one daughter. Sheema baji is very concerned about her daughter, and wants to do whatever she can to provide her daughter with a happy life.  Sheema baji embroiders dresses and sews clothes. She invests her amount in a committee and wants to marry off her daughter when she gets the whole amount. She has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy wheat to sell.

Sheema baji is a group leader. The other women in her group are:
G. sakina baji, who wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. 
Manzooran baji, who wants a loan to buy wheat to sell. 
Mumtaz baji, who wants a loan to buy plastic beans to make plastic bottles. 
Nusrat baji, who wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).  

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wheat

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita M. is a 69-year-old widowed mother of five. Her children have all moved out, and since her husband has died, she lives alone. Juanita has a business selling herbal medicine. Most of the customers she serves live in her barangay (Filipino for district or village), while some are in neighboring barangays.

Juanita plans to use this loan to buy more inventory for her business. In the future she hopes to expand her sales territory. She also would like to secure another means of transportation when on her sales route as when she travels now, she pays for rides on the back of a truck.

loans.use: To buy herbal medicines for resale

loans.name: Pana Group

texts.en: Farida is the group leader of Pana group. There are two members in this group and each of them needs a loan to expand her business. Farida wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a fruit cart. Faiz Khnum wants to take out a loan for her embroidery business. They want a loan of $600 for the term of ten months. They like this process because it can support one to expand and progress in business.

loans.use: for expanding business

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.en:
Tằn hoàng (1432050959) is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has 5 adult children. To making a living, Tằn operates a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. Tằn has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (about US $224) a month from these activities.

In 2005, Tằn joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tằn has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. Tằn is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 Dong which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. The loan will be the 4th loan she has taken out from TYM Fund. Tằn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: Raw materials for manufacturing wood products

loans.name: Balawè

texts.fr: Madame B. est une résidente du quartier d’anomè qui et un quartier périphérique de la  ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu depuis 2000 le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, elle  a ouvert à cet effet une boutique qu’elle a appelé « JARDIN DU COURAGE », son stock étant épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit afin de s’acheter 08 sacs de riz, 10 bidons d’huile, des cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 02 cartons de détergents « OMO » et d’autres produits d’alimentation générale. Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants
texts.en:
Ms. B. is a resident of Anomè, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. Since 2000, she has been earning revenues from her work selling grocery items. To do so, she opened a shop she called “JARDIN DU COURAGE”. Her inventory being exhausted, she wants to stock up again and is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy eight sacks of rice, ten drums of oil, some boxes of pasta, two boxes of OMO detergent, and other grocery items. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: A sus 26 años, Aida es madre de tres pequeños niños, Efraín de 8 años, Ruth de 4 y Alex de 6 meses, tiene una casa propia, la cual esta hecha de adobe, ella se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante y así darles a sus hijos una mejor vida. Tejiendo chullos (prendas para la cabeza), chalinas, guantes, etc, pasa sus días. Ella disfruta mucho de tejer y lo hace muy hábilmente, sus tejidos los vende en su pequeño puesto ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (lugar donde se realizan ferias en Juliaca), donde con mucha rapidez son adquiridos por sus clientes. Para el futuro de su negocio espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda brindarle una mayor comodidad a sus clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, aunque tiene 5 años de experiencia en esta actividad, todavía le sigue siendo difícil realizar los acabados de las prendas, con todo el esfuerzo que realiza, espera poder darles unos buenos estudios a sus hijos y anhela que sean unos buenos profesionales útiles a la sociedad. Aida se encuentra en su primer préstamo con MFP y está ahorrando para pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy contenta. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados planea comprar más lana para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Aida is 26 years old and has three small children, Ephraim and Ruth who are 8 and 4 years old and Alex who is 6 months old. She owns a house, which is made of adobe. She strives to give her children a better life and spends her days weaving elastic head bands, scarves, gloves, etc. She enjoys knitting and makes it very skillfully. She sells her products in a small booth that is located at the Explanada Laguna Temporal(where fairs are held in the city of Juliaca) and they are sold very quickly.

She hopes to have a shop in the future where she can provide greater convenience to her customers and increase her income. Although she has 5 years of experience in this activity, it is still difficult to make the finished garments. With all the efforts that she makes, she hopes to give her children a good education and for them to be good professionals and useful to society. This is Aida’s first loan with MFP and she is saving to pay her dues on time, as not to cause problems for members of her community bank, where she feels very happy. With the $175 that she is asking for, she is planning to buy more wool to increase her production .

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool

loans.name: Nigina

texts.ru:
Нигина – 32 года. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей детской одежды. Она торгует на рынке "Афгонбозор" в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Нигина закупает товар в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Её муж мастер строительных работ. Нигина уже 1 год кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Нигина расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она закупила партию детской обуви. Теперь у Нигины увеличился ассортимент товара. Нигина просит новый займ для закупки летней партии детской обуви.
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.
texts.en:
Nigina is 32 years old, married and has 3 children. She is involved in sales of children’s clothing at the Afgonbozor market in the Panchshanbe district of Khujand city. Nigina buys her merchandise in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyzstan Republic. She travels there once per month. Nigina’s husband is a master builder. Nigina has been a borrower with us for one year. When she first started her business, she had very limited inventory of goods. Nigina has since expanded her business and bought an inventory of children’s shoes, using her last loan. Now Nigina has a better assortment of goods. Nigina is requesting a new loan in order to purchase a stock of summer children’s shoes. MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's summer shoes

loans.name: Nesepora

texts.en: Mrs. Nesepora E. is from Yahong, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old and married with two children. Due to financial insufficiency, she decided to engage in a sari-sari store to be of assistance in finances specifically in their daily basic needs. She started with minimal capital. A relative shared with her about Paglaum MPC – its program and services. Therefore, she decided to become a full-pledged member in February 2009. Now, she availed a loan amounting to 7,000 pesos as additional capital for the sari-sari store. She admitted that it helps a lot in their necessities. She dreams someday that the business will expand to a bigger and concrete store, that she can send their children to school and live life within the standard of living.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 30-year-old young woman. She is married but currently has no children. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in their community. She trades in fresh fish, a business she has done for three years now. She takes stock of fresh fish from Kumasi. She sometimes buys on credit and repays her suppliers when she finishes selling. She says she buys on credit because she does not have enough money to buy from the suppliers. She has increased her market share and lots of people buy from her. Currently she sells the fish at home rather than the market center. She needs the loan to buy a bulk supply of fresh fish from the market. She dreams to save more in order to rent a store and also to buy a fridge to enable her to buy more fish. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Arcelia Ysallana

texts.es: Arcelia Ysallana Hernández Gutiérrez tiene 36 años. Es una mujer casada con 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica de Arcelia es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. Es una mujer muy luchadora y que le gusta su trabajo. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que inicio por cuenta propia y con el apoyo necesario de su familia ha logrado salir adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camisetas, pantalones, faldas y ropa para niños. El sueño que tanto le gustaría realizar es establecer un cafetín y una pequeña tienda donde exhiba su ropa.
texts.en:
Arcelia Ysallana Hernández Gutiérrez is 36 years old. She is married with 2 children. For a living she has been selling general merchandise for more than 9 years. She is a fighter and enjoys her work as a street vendor. She started on her own and with the support of her family she has succeeded in getting ahead. The purpose of the loan is for work capital to buy t-shirts, pants, skirts and children's clothing. It is her dream to set up a café and a small store to exhibit her clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Flor es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Flor tiene un carro el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros interprovincial a la ciudad de Vilcas, además Flor tiene una tienda de abarrotes en general en Vilcas.
Flor necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales construcción para el techado de su casa.
Flor sueña con comprar otro carro, construir su casa hasta el tercer piso y tener una ferretería.

loans.use: Para la compra de materiales construcción para el techado de su casa.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. is married and has seven dependants. She has no educational background.  Mary sells cooked banku for sale. She goes to the market buys maize and processes it into banku and fry fish alongside to sell at Elmina near Boatyards, which he has been doing since 1979. His wife is a fisherman.  Mary uses his income to support in the payment of bills and settlement of school fees.  Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to enable her prepare banku in a large quantity for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Mary plans to save towards building of her own house.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more maize to enable her prepare banku in a large quantity for sale.

loans.name: Mr. Vaen Vann Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Ten people who are all living in Thlok village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan. Mr. Vaen V. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.  They all will use the loan for different purposes.  Mr. Vaen V. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice to earn a living. He is a 62-year-old widower with three children, two of whom are marketing employers and the third child helps with his father’s work. Now Mr. Vaen V. is requesting a loan to buy piglets and chickens for breeding to earn income for his household. 

Four members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy piglets and chickens for breeding to earn income for his household.

loans.name: Eom

texts.en: Eom N., 59, is married and resides in Battambong Province with his wife (pictured) and a child. To make a living, He manufactures rice wine and raises pigs for their offspring at home, earning an income of US $3 per day. His wife travels through the town and villages in the province to collect and purchase recyclable materials for resale, earning an income of US $3 per day to cover the family expenses. This couple is seeking to improve their standard of living by working hard every day. Therefore, N. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport the rice wine product and recycle materials to sell. By doing so, N. hopes that she will be able to cut back on public transportation expenses and save the extra income for the future household use.

loans.use: buy a motorbike to transport wine for sale

loans.name: Flordelina

texts.en:
53 years old Flordelina M. owns a 1 and 1/4 hectare farm. Her 22-year-old child was not able to go to college due to the lack of family income. Her family cannot afford the tuition because it is very expensive and their earnings are very low.  Like any other businesspersons, she desired to be successful in her business. She wants to prosper with her farm and make it more productive to support the daily needs. 

Flordelina would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her business. Receiving this loan is truly worthwhile because this will help her improve her harvest.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Pom

texts.en:
Mrs. Pom S., age 34, lives in her own small house with other family members in Kompong Tom province. To earn a living, she sells retail cooking ingredients that she buys in bulk from the market at reasonable price. Some of her clients are her nearby neighbors, who also buy her produce on credit for a few days.

To help be responsible for family, her husband works in construction for a profit. This couple has two small kids. Pom S. requests a loan to purchase a motorcycle, which she will use for touring purposes.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle, which she will use for touring purposes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen T. is a 50-year-old mother to five children living in Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. Her husband, Ferigryn, is a driver. Carmen sells fruits and vegetables and homemade sausages to neighbors. She earns P4,000.00 a month, which she saves to support the education of her children. Since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006, Carmen has been enjoying its many benefits for its members, who are mostly housewives. She is now on her tenth loan cycle with CCT. She is expecting to receive a new loan from the cooperative in the amount of P12, 000.00, which she will use as additional capital for her business. She dreams of having a more permanent place of business, like a market stall. 

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and an evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her food business

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
K. is 57 years of age and is the widowed mother of seven children. Four of her children are married and live independently and the remainder are single.

K. owns a restaurant located near the market, where she sells Chinese noodles and soft drinks. Most of her children also help her in the business when they are not working or studying.

K. wants to improve her business in order to achieve her goal of attracting more clients. She is asking for a loan to widen her restaurant and to buy more attractive equipment to decorate her shop.

loans.use: To widen her restaurant and to buy more attractive equipment to decorate her shop

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence, age 33, has a business selling tailoring supplies in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria, where she lives. She is client of LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization), which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She sells tailoring materials at retail prices to her customers. She is also a fashion designer and she makes lovely Nigerian clothing designs for her customers. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. Prudence is married and has no children.

She is requesting for a loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Norma Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. Norma  tiene 37  años de edad. Es conviviente  tienen 4 hijos menores de edad de 18, 16,8 y 2 años. Tres  de sus primeros hijos de su primer compromiso y el ultimo  de su compromiso actual.Ella cuenta con casa propia de material noble recientemente construido aun sin acabados. La Sra Norma  cuenta con un negocio de una pequeña tienda en su domicilio, se inicio en este negocio hace 4 años, ella  tiene muchos sueños y objetivos uno de ellos es poder tener un negocio mucho mas grande, La Sra. Norma es una persona muy activa y emprendedora, con el dinero que solicita invertira en hacer algunos acabados del local de  su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma is 37 years old. She has a partner and four minor children ages 18, 16, 8 and 2. The first three children are from a prior relationship and her last one is with her current partner. Mrs. Norma has her own house made of good material. It is recently constructed but is not finished. Mrs. Norma has a small store in her home. She has had this store for four years. She has a lot of dreams, one of which is to have a much larger store. Mrs. Norma is an energetic and enterprising person. With the money that she is requesting, she will finish with the construction of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will improve her home.

loans.name: Anok

texts.en:
Anok E. is currently in the business of selling beans, maize flour and pulses (edible seeds of legumes) in the market and is requesting a loan to purchase bags of  sugar and salt to sell.  Anok is 45 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a larger shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase bags of  sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Narimon

texts.en:
Narimon B. is 20 years old. He is a cattleman, who raises cattle to sell. At the same time, Narimon sells dried fruits in the local market. Narimon has been working as a market vendor for 3 years. Thanks to these two businesses, Narimon is able to support his parents with their household expenses. Today, Narimon is going to increase the turnover capital for his business selling dried fruits. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting $3000 US Dollars. The loan will be spent on purchasing dried fruits and cattle for selling. This is the first loan for Narimon, however, he is sure he shall be able to pay it in time and thanks everyone who trusts him with their support. 
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried fruits to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan E. is from the village of Maac, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Susan owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing videoke (video karaoke) services to local community members. Susan has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Susan is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. This will be the second loan Susan has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated  to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services

loans.name: Fiorella Elizabeth

texts.es: La Srta. H. E. Fiorella Elizabeth tiene 23años de edad vive con sus padres  desde muy pequeña vio el ejemplo de su madre que se dedicaba a vender productos de belleza, nace en ella  la inquietud de poder incursionar en la venta de productos de belleza y así poder ayudar a su familia, es bastante emprendedora, y posteriormente desea tener estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Miss H. E. Fiorella Elizabeth is 23 years old and lives with her parents. Since she was a child, she has seen her mother's example of selling beauty products. From then, her desire to sell beauty products was born because she wants to help her family out. She is quite enterprising, and would also like get a higher education in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina owns a sari-sari (variety) store, her only way of earning an income for her family. Her store started in 2003 and now it’s improving. She requested a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to help finance her business.

Gina is the mother of five children and wishes them to earn a degree. She’s asking a loan of 10,000 Php to buy more groceries for her store. This will sustain her business and family.

With her loan, Gina hopes to repay at the proper time.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma S. is a 57 year old married woman with 4 children who lives in Sitio Macasayang, Barangay Mabini, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. Emma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for 3 years now and earns a living by running a general store business. She is purchasing a solar lantern with a PHP 3,100 loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and at the same time cut fuel costs and save money in the long run. About NWTF’s Green Loan Products Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save money for its clients. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as charging stations for mobile phones. These families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes. The solar lantern offers a free environmentally friendly renewable source of energy that allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Purchase of Solar Lantern

loans.name: Biola

texts.en: Biola sells electronics at retail prices to his customers.  He hopes to own an electronic company in the future. He has been in this business for a long time.  He is 32 years old, married with 2 children. He lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. His wife sells clothes to also support their home. He is requesting for a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more electronics to sell.  He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more electronics to sell

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es: Ramón J. C., tiene la edad de 38 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos de 15, 11 y 9 años de edad, y son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Ramón  también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Ramón J. C. is 38 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their three children ages 15, 11 and 9, who are his first priority. He is requesting this loan to help with his farm, specifically the cultivation of coffee—he intends to buy manure and fertilizer. He hopes to properly maintain his coffee crop in order to achieve better quality and to obtain the greatest possible income at harvest time. This is the first time he has taken out a loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the opportunities they offer. Ramon has worked in agriculture for many years. He hopes in the future to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to keep growing as a person and a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Coffee growing

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela L. S. y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de pan dulce este distribuyen por las colonias ofreciéndolo con una bocina y así es como ellos venden toda su mercancía. La panadería es llamada La Bendición que ya tiene una antigüedad de 6 años, negocio que ha beneficiado en sustento de esta familia. Gabriela esta muy agradecida ya que con este será su segundo crédito y que gracias a el ha ido prosperando. Para seguir teniendo más ganancias necesita un préstamo para comprar más producto para elaboración del pan.
texts.en:
Gabriela L. S. and her husband work in the production of sweet bread that they distribute throughout residential developments, advertising it by loudspeaker. This is how they sell all their merchandise. The bakery is called La Bendicion, is 6 years old and has been sustained by the family. Gabriela is very grateful that this will be her second loan and that thanks to that she has been prospering. In order to continue making a profit she needs a loan to buy more products for the production of the bread.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase supplies and inventory

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen A. is from the village of  North Poblacion, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 40 years old. Allen is married and has 2 school-aged children. Allen owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells herbal food supplements. Allen has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Allen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Allen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en:
K. Wilbroad, 63 years old, has been operating a cattle farm in Kyeganywa, Ibanda, where he has been selling cows to the periodic markets in western Uganda. In this business, he deals directly with farmers to purchase their cattle and then rears them for some time until he finds a ready market where he supplies butchers, hotels and other customers.

His main disadvantages in running this business have been the unstable cattle market prices and low capital input. With hard work and efficient customer care skills, he has managed to keep his business going for over 25 years. In a month, he makes profits in the amount of 200,000 UGX. His future plans are to fully expand his transactions which he says will see him earn more revenue to pay for his children’s education and other family requirements. With this loan, he wants to purchase more cattle for his farm.

loans.use: Purchase more cattle for his farm

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is separated and has four children. He is a hardworking and dedicated trader in cassettes (video and tape) and electronic appliances. His shop is located along Rogbaneh Road in Makeni.
Abass has sixteen years' experience in business. He is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 SLL to buy more electronic appliances and cassettes. He wants to buy more modern videos and televisions to meet the tastes of his customers. This is his second successive loan, and for the past year he has made all his loan repayments on time. He hopes to use the proceeds of his loan to educate his children to university level and buy some land, which will be

loans.use: To buy more electrical appliances and cassettes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy vegetables, such as onions, peppers, lemons, and shellfish

loans.name: María Rocio

texts.es: María Roció R. E. tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece refrescos, comida enlatada, botanas, dulces, artículos de limpieza y para tener un ingreso extra vende hamburguesas que ella misma prepara. Este negocio ya tiene 12 años establecido al cual quiere comprar mercancía para tener mas variedad en producto y sí le generen más ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Rocio Rodriguez E. has a grocery store from where she sells soft drinks, canned foods, snacks, candies, and household cleaning supplies, and to have an additional source of income she also sells hamburgers that she makes herself. She has been running this business for the past 12 years and she would like to purchase merchandise to have a greater selection in her inventory, and thus generate greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Sam-An

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-an M. and his wife, Mrs. Samphor Heng (pictured together), have been married since 1986 and have four children -- two sons and two daughters. One of the daughters is married and lives outside the family home.  The other three children are in school. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sam-an is a deputy school principal of a college. His wife sells meal in a school near their house. Sam-an now is applying for his second loan of $600 to pay school fees for his son to continue his studies in his third year.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his son to continue his studies in his third year.

loans.name: Elizabeth Jepwambok

texts.en:
Elizabeth Jepwambok C., a hardworking 50-year-old lady, is married to Philip Bargoiyet C. and together they have four children aged 27, 25, 23 and 7 years respectively. She has been operating a general shop for about 15 years and earns a monthly income of Kshs 15,000.

Elizabeth learned about and joined KADET LTD a while back. Now applying for her sixth loan of Kshs. 30,000 from KADET LTD to buy a stock of nine bags of sugar, she plans to use the profits from the expanded business to start a second enterprise in dairy farming which is also very marketable in this area.

Elizabeth hopes to grow her business, become the leading local investor, and see her children realizing their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy nine bags of sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To release the electronic goods that are waiting for him at the port

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Samundri, a small city known for its agriculture industry, located in Punjab. A housewife who stays at home and performs her household duties, she is very cooperative and always ready to help her family to overcome life's difficulties.

Sakina is married to M. S., who works in the field growing a variety of seasonal crops to fulfill the basic needs of the family. He has vast experience and knowledge in this livelihood. They have two sons, one who works on a poultry farm and also sells goats, while the younger one works in a factory on a monthly wage.

A regular client of Kiva partner Asasah, Sakina is requesting her second loan so her elder son can buy goats to sell to his customers at a good profit. She is confident that this investment will be a productive one for her son and that his business will be improved. Sakina is a responsible client and paid her duties responsibly in her previous loan year.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy goats for selling

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en:
Quý Nghiêm Thị (20201070014) is a 50-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is married and has three adult children.  To make a living, Quý owns and operates a business venture in the food sector – operating a butcher shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from butchering and selling a variety of meats in the local community. Quý has been engaged in this business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4,200,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, Quý joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Quý has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,392,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Quý is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Quý from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Viet Nam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Quý Nghiêm Thị (20201070014) là 50 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 3 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Quý Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán nhiều loại T.t khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Quý thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 12 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Quý kiếm được khoảng 4.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, Quý đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Quý đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các vật dụng mới để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Quý dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia F. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 and married with seven children. Her eldest child is 23 years old and the youngest is 7. Ofelia is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops to earn a living. She also raises hogs to augment her family income. Ofelia works hard to help sustain her children's education. 

Ofelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seed, fertilizer, piglets and feed.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, piglets and feed.

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en:
Eulogia P. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub. She is 56 years old. Eulogia is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Eulogia owns & operates a business venture in the services sector running a service-based business. 

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing sewing services in the local community. Eulogia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eulogia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eulogia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Eulogia is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eulogia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Cesar Alberto

texts.es:
Cesar, reside en San Miguel donde vive con su esposa, se dedican a la venta de ropa, al taller de sastrería, venden agua en garrafas y también venden sandalias, la sastrería la aprendió joven, el comercio también lo aprendió hace 13 años, esta es la labor que junto a su esposa realizan diariamente.
Actualmente quieren comprar ropa nueva  para vender en esta fiesta navideña que ya se acercan, Su propósito es estar preparados para la venta ya que no quieren pasar una navidad sin ingresos; su proyección es ser un comerciante de éxito, tener mucha clientela y ofrecer los mejores productos y ropa fina.
texts.en:
Cesar lives in San Miguel with his wife. He manages a clothing stand, operates a tailoring shop, and sells bottled water and sandals. Cesar learned tailoring as a young man and how to run a business thirteen years ago. He and his wife work together every day.

Cesar currently wants to buy new clothing to sell for the approaching Christmas season. His goal is to be prepared for making sales because he does not want Christmas to pass by without any income. He has aspirations to become a successful merchant, have many customers, and offer the best products and fine clothing.

loans.use: Purchase new clothing to sell

loans.name: Poni

texts.en: Poni M. is currently in the business of selling food stuffs and is requesting a loan to stock more food like bread, beer, soft drinks etc to sell.  Poni is 26 years old and is married to a husband who is a fisherman. She has 4 children and one child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock more food like bread, beer soft drinks etc to sell

loans.name: Ma. Margie

texts.en:
Ma. Margie D. is from the town of Panglao. She is 38 years old. Ma. Margie is married and has 4 children who are 12, 17, 19, and 21 years old. To make a living, Ma. Margie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling bread and "bukayo" (sweets made of young coconut). 

Ma. Margie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Margie is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
A. JEAN PIERRE
Commerçant de 53 ans, père de 4 enfants de 9 à 28 ans célibataire s'est lance dans la fourniture scolaire et divers il ya 17 ans, avec 35000 de capital. Ses ventes sont de 25000 à 35000 frs par jour. 
Pour sa stratégie il se lève de bonne heure et se rend au marché pour accueillir les premiers clients ainsi que avoir une diversité des marchandises. 
Avec ce prêt qu'il compte recevoir il va acheter des cartons de cahiers, de livres, ardoise, crayons de couleurs, bic , sac, calculatrice. Son ambition est d'avoir une boutique de fournitures scolaires et se marier ainsi de bien scolariser son enfant. Dans le quartier tout le monde le connait du plus petit au plus grand.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre Akambina, a merchant, is a 53-year-old single father of four children ranging in age from 9 to 28 years old. He started selling school supplies and various other items 17 years ago with a capital of 35,000 francs. His sales average 25,000 to 35,000 francs per day.

His strategy is to get up early to go to the market and welcome his first customers, and to offer a variety of goods.

With this loan, he plans to buy boxes of notebooks, books, writing slates, crayons, pens, bags, and calculators. His goals are to open a school supplies store, get married, and provide his children with a good education. Everyone knows him in the neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy reams of paper, boxes of pens, writing slates, boxes of books

loans.name: Alicia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La sra. Alicia del Carmen Z. es comerciante y su actividad principal es la venta de ropa interior nueva, tiene dos años de realizar dicha actividad.
Doña Alicia realiza sus ventas de forma ambulante en diferentes fábricas de puros de esta ciudad, al igual que en oficinas públicas, la mayor parte de estas ventas las realiza al crédito por lo que deja un día a la semana para cobrar.
Doña Alicia cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, esto es debido a la facilidad de pagos que ofrece a sus clientes, la amabilidad con la que los atiende y que lleva el producto hasta donde se encuentran los clientes.
Es notable que doña Alicia a sabido administrar su negocio y sus condiciones de vida son muy favorables.
Doña Alicia es madre soltera de una hija, la cual es maestra de educación primaria,  esto gracias al apoyo que doña Alicia le brindo en el trascurso de sus estudios, hoy su hija es una persona de bien para la sociedad.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa interior.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alicia del Carmen Z. is a merchant selling new underwear.  She’s been in business two years.

Alicia sells going from cigar factory to cigar factory in this city as well as to public offices.  Most of her sales are on credit so the dedicates one day a week for payment collection.

Alicia has quite a few customers thanks to the easy payment plans she offers, the kindness with which she takes care of them and because she takes the items to them wherever they are.

It is noteworthy that Alicia has known how to run her business and her living conditions are very favorable.

Alicia is a single mother.  Her daughter is an elementary school teacher thanks to the support her mother provided throughout her schooling.  Today, her daughter is a person who benefits society.

She will use the loan to buy underwear.

loans.use: To buy women's and men's underwear.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 54 years old, married to a policeman, and has 6 children 4 of them go to school. She is currently in the business of selling soft drinks. Juliana is borrowed a loan to stock more soft drinks to sell. In the future, she hopes to pay her children in school with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Monsieur Amévi est marié et a un enfant. Il est âgé de 37 ans. Il est née à vogan et habite quartier Adamavo.  Il est Directeur de l’Institut Technique les Elites qui se trouve derrière le lycée à Baguida. Il dirige cette école depuis 2005. Il demande un prêt pour achater les tables bancs et les outils de tavail pour l’Etablissement.
texts.en: Mr. Amévi is married and has a child.  He is 37 years old.  He was born in Vogan and lives in the Adamavo district.  He is the director of the Technical Institute for Elites, which is located behind the high school in Baguida.  He has directed the school since 2005.  He is asking for a loan to buy bench tables and work tools for the establishment.

loans.use: to purchase bench tables and work tools.

loans.name: Rakan

texts.ar: ركان في عمر 62 سنة يعمل في بيع الطعام والمواد الغذائية والمعلبات وغيره له في عمله 19 سنة متزوج وله 4 اولاد يعمل بكد ونشاط محب للعمل يطور عمله باستمرار يريد ان يزيد من مدخول عائلته وتطويرهم ماديا واجتماعيا يتميز عمله بوجود جميع متطلبات منطقته يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تقوية المصلحة وشراء بضاعة جديدة للمتجر يواجه صعوب فقط في راس المال وهذا ما ينقصه ليتطور
texts.en: Rakan is 62 years old and works selling foods, groceries and canned food items, etc. He has 19 years of experience in his work. He is married and has four children. He works very hard and likes to work. He continually strives to develop his business. He would like to increase the income of his family, and to improve their material situation and social status. His business stands out from others because he offers all of the needed items in his region. With a loan from al-Majmoua, he would like to buy new goods for his store. The only difficulty he faces in his business is a lack of capital, and this is what hinders him from developing his business.

loans.use: to obtain new goods for his grocery store.

loans.name: Moyopata-San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOYOPATA-SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cosme; ella es conviviente y tiene 41 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de artefactos y ropa, ella tiene una tienda donde vende artefactos y ropa de segunda mano, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa y artefactos de segunda mano. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa y artefactos.

Los otros socios  se dedican la venta de comida, venta de verduras, tienda de abarrotes y venta de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Moyopata-San Sebastian community bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Cosme. She lives with her partner, is 41 years old and has five children. She works at her business selling artifacts and clothing. She has a store where she sells second-hand artifacts and clothing. She works from 9AM until 6PM and through this business, she gets her children ahead. She wants to expand her business selling second-hand clothing and artifacts. She is requesting the loan to buy clothing and artifacts.

The other members are dedicated to selling food, vegetables, a grocery store and selling clothing.

The member is thankful to those who are a part of this dream in this way and promises to make the repayments at the established deadlines.

loans.use: to buy clothes and artifacts.

loans.name: Ronald Froilan

texts.es:
Ronald es un hombre soltero de 21 años, vive en  casa de sus padres, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en el caserío Huaca Partida, el cual se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del distrito de Pítipo y a unos 30 minutos aproximadamente del departamento de Lambayeque.  Lugar donde se desarrolla  la actividad agricola   y  la crianza de animales.

Ronald se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas,pavos y patos) desde hace unos 2 años, su corral lo tiene en la parte posterior de su casa,  su negocio lo realiza en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo los días martes y viernes donde hay mayor cantidad de clientela y así pueda vender más rápido sus animales.  Con esos ingresos pude ayudar  a  sus padres a cubrir las  necesidades diarias.

El crédito solicitado por Ronalda a Edpyme Alternativa es de 800 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para su aves de corral  y seguir negociandolo en los diferentes mercados de la zona. Una vez que haya realizado las  ventas de sus aves de corral podrá pagar su préstamo como tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y sus padres.

Ronald es un hijo muy responsable y trabajador por eso dedica todo su tiempo en tratar de ayudar a sus padres con la finalidad de que ellos se sientan bien.
texts.en: Ronald is a 21-year-old single man and lives in his parents' home, which has water and electric services. It is located in the village of Huaca Partida, about 15 minutes from the district of Pítipo and approximately 30 minutes from the department of Lambayeque. It is here where Ronald makes a living in agriculture and livestock, buying, raising and selling poultry (chickens, turkeys and ducks) for the past two years. His farmyard is in the back of the house, and he makes his sales at the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo on Tuesdays and Fridays, when there is a larger number of customers and he can sell his animals more quickly. With the income, he has helped his parents cover necessary daily expenses. Ronald is requesting a loan of 800 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to purchase balanced feed for his birds and to continue doing business at the different markets in the area. Once he has sold his birds he will be able to repay they loan, and he and his parents will have a better quality of life. Ronald is a very responsible and hard-working son, which is why he dedicates all his time to trying to help his parents and make them feel good.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for his poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MADRES TRABAJADORAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Tica Tica, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 35 años de edad; La socia es conviviente;  La socia tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad y ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo que tiene en la municipalidad; la socia es miembro integrante de este banco y ella manifiesta que es toda un apoyo ser parte del grupo puesto que cuando ella requiere de un monto para invertirlo en la mejora de su vivienda o comprar algunos artefactos para la casa lo puede pagar en una sola cuota y al banco ir pagando en partes de tal modo que su sueldo puede ser bien distribuido en la educación de su hijo y en la alimentación y otros pagos de servicios básicos del hogar. La socia en esta ocasión requiere el préstamo para poder invertir en la vivienda ella manifiesta que desea mejorar su vivienda y está ampliando un ambiente una habitación para ello ella desea el crédito para comprar materiales como cemento, arenas, ladrillos para revestir las paredes, también el techo y el pago al albañil. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda. 

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo que le otorgarán y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “MADRES TRABAJADORAS” (Working Mothers) communal bank which is located in Tica Tica District, Cusco Province and Department.

The member is 35.  She has a live-in spouse and a 15-year-old son.  She alternates her household chores with a job she has with the city.  She is a member of this bank and she states that it’s quite an advantage to be part of this group because when she needs a slightly higher amount and can’t quite cover it with her salary the bank helps her to pay off all at once and then continue paying the bank bit by bit while still paying for her son’s education without problem.

On this occasion she needs a loan to invest in her home.  She states that she’d like to do some home improvements.  She is enlarging a room and needs the loan to buy the necessary materials.  She requests the loan to invest in her home.

She is satisfied with the granted loan and promises to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and has two children. He lives with five family members; two of them work.

Karar has had a farm for cattle and calves since 2009. He worked in this field since he was child so he has a lot of experience. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. 

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to build a cow barn. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To build a cow barn.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 49 years old and married with four children. With four children in school, Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her sari-sari store.

Nenita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, milk, sugar, etc.

In the future, Nenita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy lives in Uganda.  She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. Dorothy has a tailoring business. She has been in this business for two years, and she works one day out of every week. Dorothy sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. She has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing material and thread. The main business challenges for Dorothy include seasonality and transportation.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a tailoring school. Dorothy lives in a home that she rents/owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, electricity bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy rolls of clothing material and thread

loans.name: Felix Ruperto

texts.es:
Felix Ruperto tiene 35 años, Es soltero vive  solo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto los Ángeles, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Felix se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz  . Compra sus productos en Comercial Procan y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades.Enfrenta desafios como la falta de dinero para invertir. Su sueño es llegar hacer un gran agricultor.

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura y reunirse con la familia los domingos por que extraña a sus padres.
texts.en:
Felix Ruperto, 35, is single and lives alone in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank CIUDADELA LOS ANGELES, which is involved agriculture, is located in the Los Ángeles Community, in the Ventanas Canton.

Felix grows corn and rice, buying his supplies in Comercial Procan and selling his produce at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

He is requesting a loan to plant corn and rice, and to buy supplies and fertilizer. The loan will help him economically to supply his needs.  He is up against challenges such has lacking money to invest.  His dream is to become a large farmer.

He enjoys working in agriculture and meeting with family on Sundays because he misses his parents.

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine‘s group is comprised of three hard-working young women. Justine is 16 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Justine has a business selling food, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Justine hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.  In the future, Justine hopes to become a doctor after her studies.

Justine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Haja. She is married and has two children, ages 20 and 6. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she helps her in her business. In 2001, Haja established her business making cooked food. She began her business because she wanted to earn money on her own in order to provide for her family. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy ingredients for cooking. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL. In the future, she plans to have a big modern restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her fishing/fish vending business.

Lorlyn has been in this business for 25 years. Lorlyn earns more income from buying and selling fermented shrimp.

Lorlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a hard-working business man. He is married and blessed with three children. He repairs electronics, particularly radios and televisions, to earn a living. He has been engaged in this business for 13 years. In the next five years, Joseph wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy spare parts for televisions and radios. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Jennery

texts.en:
Jennery works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Jennery has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from e-loading.

Jennery requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy material for her tailoring business. In the future, Jennery would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José es una mujer de 43 años, Desde hace 2 años ella se dedica a una librería. Esta actividad la empezó por motivación propia con ahorros de salario, pues trabaja como docente,  para así poder aportar económicamente a su hogar. Es no es su primer crédito pues está convencida de que esto le ayudará a tener mayor ingreso para su familia. Maria nos cuenta que lo más complicado del negocio es convencer al cliente, es por esto que ella diariamente trata de mejorar su manera de expresarse. El crédito es para la compra de hojas de block, cartulinas, lapiceros, borradores, reglas, resaltadores entre otros.
texts.en:
María José, 43, has been running a stationery shop for the last two years.  She started the business on her own initiative to help support her household with savings from her salary because she works as a teacher.  

This isn’t her first loan because she’s convinced that this will help her have higher income for her family.  María tells us that the most complicated thing about her business is convincing customers and this is why she tries daily to improve her manner of speaking.  The loan will be used to buy binder paper, construction paper, mechanical pencils, erasers, rulers and highlighters, among others.

loans.use: to buy binder paper, construction paper, mechanical pencils, erasers, rulers and highliters.

loans.name: Saly

texts.en:
Saly is 44 years old, married, and has three children two of whom attend school and one of whom is working.  She is a fish seller and earns $15 per day.  

Every month, Saly spends $100 on food, $5 on electricity, $20 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She is requesting a loan for $1100, which she will use to buy fish to sell. This loan will help her family to have enough to continue her career of selling fish. Saly is trying to support her children to study in the university so that they can get good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a 50-year-old Lebanese single man, living with one parent and sibling. He has been working as a freelance painter for the past 20 years. 

Today, he is asking for a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new painting products and tools. This will be his first Kiva loan, and he is sure that it will allow him to achieve remarkable growth with the coming year. In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to buy new painting products and tools

loans.name: Martha De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, la señora Martha de los Ángeles   se dedica arduamente a laborar como operadora de planta telefónica y se dedica a esta labor desde hace tres años. Es soltera tiene a su cargo dos persona.

Actualmente ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar  crédito para compra de materiales de construcción tales como cemento, arena, bloque para  hacer un cuarto   para darle una  condición de su vivienda mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Martha de los Ángeles works hard as a telephone operator in the city of Managua; she’s had this job for three years.  She’s single and has two people in her care.  She has called on Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, sand and concrete blocks to build a room to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Donato

texts.es: El señor Donato trabaja como chofer asalariado en uno de los sindicatos de choferes de La Paz y su esposa se dedica a la confección de centros para señoras de pollera; los mismos son vendidos en una feria que funciona todos los días de la semana en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito sera para el negocio de su esposa ya que adquirirá telas que son su materia prima al por mayor para abaratar costos. Donato y su esposa viven en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Obispo Bosque en la ciudad de La Paz; están casados y tienen tres hijos.
texts.en:
