About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando, de 48 años, es un hombre sabio y trabajador, esta casado con Esperanza, de 46 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos; pero solo viven con dos de ellos, Jonathan de 23 y Jens de 8 años, en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Huaracayo. Él vive en un pequeño paraje a las afueras de la ciudad de Tarma; ahí se ubica su acogedora casa, donde todos los días se dirige muy contento a cuidar de sus terrenos de cultivo. Hace ya 20 años que se inicia en la labor más sacrificada y noble, “la agricultura”; aquí aprendió a cultivar una variedad de hortalizas y maíz; que son el alimento primordial en todo el país y las amas de casa lo consumen a diario. Por ello Armando comenzó a vender sus cosechas a la capital del país; donde hay más demanda y mayores compradores; con ello quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida,”con la educación que se merecen”, menciona. Para su futuro quiere sembrar en mayores cantidades y poder abastecer a las grandes empresas que se dedican a la venta de alimentos. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y como miembro de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho de poder aportar en el desarrollo y ahorro de su asociación. Con el crédito que obtendrá, piensa comprar abono para sus 25 tongos de maíz, que equivale a toda la extensión de terrenos de cultivo que posee.
texts.en:
48-year old Armando is a wise and hardworking man. He is married to 46-year old Esperanza, and they have four children. Only two of them still live at home, 23-year old Jonathan and 8-year old Jens. They have their own house in the village of Huaracayo, a little place on the outskirts of Tarma. Everyday Armando leaves his cosy house and happily sets off to work in his fields. He's been a farmer for twenty years and considers it demanding yet noble work. He has learned how to grow a variety of vegetables and maize, very important crops throughout the country and eaten on a daily basis.

Armando sells his produce in the capital city where there is more demand and more buyers. With the money he earns he wants to help his children attain a better quality of life and 'have the education that they deserve.' In the future he wishes to plant larger quantities so that he can supply the large businesses that sell food. 

This is his tenth loan with Kiva partner, MFP, and as a member of his community bank, Armando is satisfied to be able to contribute to the development and savings of his association. With this loan he plans to buy fertilizer for all his maize fields.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Sudi

texts.en: Sudi is 28 years old. He is married and has one child who is one year old. Sudi sells juice, milk and soda. He has spent one and half years in this business. With this loan he will buy more juice and soda to sell. With the profit he will increase the volume of soda and juice he has been selling. He says that his business will prosper because of his good services and quality products. He would like to sell clothes in the future.

loans.use: To buy more juice and soda to sell.

loans.name: Phe's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Angk village, Kandal province. This group members selected Mrs. Phe S., 49-year-old married woman, as the group leader. The members hope that the loan will increase their income to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Phe S. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare rice field to cultivate rice for a living. She works very hard with the farm, but she still does not have enough money to support the rice field.  Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Chay Ry, is a fisherman and he also helps his wife in farming. This couple has four children. Two of the children are seamstresses in the garment factory and the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticide to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 39 years old. Rosalinda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda raises crops, primarily rice, for sale. Rosalinda is just starting this business.

Rosalinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies and additional piglets and feeds. This will be the ninth loan taken by Rosalinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:
Community Economic Ventures, Inc., (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, it has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI earned a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, piglets and feeds

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo S. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old. Edgardo is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Edgardo owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing welding services to local community members. Edgardo has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Edgardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edgardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9400 PHP from GDMPC. Edgardo is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Edgardo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Chizi Mwero

texts.en:
Chizi Mwero N., 38 years old, is married and together with her spouse they have seven children. Chizi owns a food café and has been in this business for the last twelve years. This marks her second loan from KADET LTD. 

She plans to invest the loan to purchase flour, rice and cereals and to renovate the café. She has directed the anticipated profits to her children’s education. Her dream is to own a big hotel.

loans.use: to purchase flour, rice and cereals and to renovate the café

loans.name: Shadia

texts.en:
Shadia N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Bugembe in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Shadia has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Shadia has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Shadia hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to continue with her studies. Shadia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by assisting her in improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Malick

texts.fr: Malick B. est un célibataire sans enfant age de 29ans c est un soudeur mécanicien de profession Il vend précisément des baguettes pièces pour meules scie à métaux il n'a pas de problèmes d'écoulement car ses marchandises sont utilisées dans son atelier par son patron. Ce prêt est destiné à renforcer son activité commerciale avec l'acquisition d'accessoires  et d'autres marchandises destinées à la soudure mécanique
texts.en:
Malick B. is 29 years old. He is single and has no children. A welder by profession, he sells rods, parts for grinding wheels, and metal saws. He doesn't have any distribution problems because his merchandise is used in his workshop, by his boss. 

The loan will be used to increase his business activity by purchasing accessories and other merchandise used for mechanical welding.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 25 años se dedica cultivar alfalfa en sus propios terrenos de cultivo y las vende  al por mayor a sus clientes que son comerciantes de alfalfa, la ventaja que tiene de su negocio es que sus terrenos son de su propiedad que le permite mayores márgenes de ganancia, de esta manera puede solventar la economía de su hogar. Su esposo  trabaja junto con ella en sus terrenos desde las primeras horas de la mañana para cortar la alfalfa y repartir a su clientela. Durante estos años ha visto el crecimiento de su negocio que ha decidió seguir mejorando sus cultivos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta y motivada de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in her own home.  For over 25 years she has been growing alfalfa on her own farmland. She sells the crop wholesale to alfalfa merchants.  The advantage she has is that she owns the land and therefore has a higher profit margin allowing her to cover household expenses.

Her husband works alongside her from the early morning on harvesting the alfalfa and delivering it to customers.  Over the years she has seen her business grow and so has decided to improve her crop.  This is her first loan through MFP.  She is excited and motivated knowing she has this financial support.  She is grateful to all the lenders who are contributing to her progress.  She plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Sol

texts.en:
Sol T. is from the village Langatian. He is 48 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. He operates a family member's business in the agriculture sector, raising pigs in the backyard. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Sol joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Sol is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This will be his 1st loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Toro Blanco, son 19 mujeres quienes se agruparon para formar un comité solidario, las mismas son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, poseen un espíritu emprendedor y de ayuda mutua. Son personas que se reúnen semanalmente, con el compromiso de no fracasar y de sobresalir trabajando en equipo, con el apoyo que le ofrece la Fundación Paraguaya actualmente están en el 8vo ciclo.
La sra. Grismilda posee una despensa en la que invierte cada vez que retiran un crédito, ella se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo constante que les brinda Kiva mediante Fundación Praguaya. Mediante su almacén ella mantiene económicamente a su familia, y desea poder generar mayores ingresos, por ello solicita un nuevo crédito para abastecer mejor su despensa con todas las frutas, verduras, panificados y bebidas que necesitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the Toro Blanco neighborhood.  It has 19 women who joined together to form a communal bank.  They are responsible, hard working women with an entrepreneurial and mutually supportive spirit.  They meet weekly committed to not fail and to stand out working as a team with the support that Fundación Paraguaya provides; they are currently in their 8th cycle.

Grismilda has a grocery store that she invests in every time they take out a loan.  She is very grateful for the constant support Kiva provides through Fundación Paraguaya.

Her store provides economic support for her family and she would like to generate higher income.  Because of this she’s asked for a new loan to stock her store with all the fruit, vegetables, baked goods and beverages her customers need.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, baked goods and beverages

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Jesusa works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling of cosmetics. Jesusa is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, juices, etc to sell in her food vending business.

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Maria Orfelinda

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años de edad, es casada  y reside junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el caserío Punto cuatro, Sialupe , un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta de animales aves de corral, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 10 años. Ella cría animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes de la zona y al público en general. Adicionalmente María ella tiene un pequeño establecimiento desde hace 4 años en su domicilio donde ofrece productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio le sirve para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María desea adquirir algunos animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar sus ventas, asi también comprar algunos productos para su bodega. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Maria, age 31, is married and lives with her husband and her two children in the Punto cuatro settlement in the Sialupe district -- a district populated by humble and hardworking people who make their living through agriculture. Sialupe is part of the Lambayeque province; it is located about forty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Maria grows barnyard fowl and small farm animals; she has been in this line of work for over ten years. She grows her animals in the backyard of her home and when they reach a good level of development, she sells them to the local merchants as well as to the general public. In addition, for about four years, Maria has had a small convenience store in her home where she sells groceries and basic necessity products. This business allows her to cover her personal expenses and helps with the financial needs of her household.

Maria would like to purchase some additional animals and balanced animal feed in order to increase her sales; she would also like to purchase some inventory for her convenience store. For this reason, she decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and balanced animal feed

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier tiene 42 años de edad. El es casado y vive con su esposa y sus dos menores hijos. Ellos tienen una casa propia y está situada en un caserío “cruce de vega” en el distrito de Tambogrande en el departamento de  Piura en el norte de Perú. Javier vive en la parte rural de esta localidad, pero aun así cuenta con servicio de luz.

Javier se dedica  a la agricultura. Esta actividad es el sustento de su hogar, para la que cuenta con un área de 2.00 hectáres, en la cual tiene 1.50 hectáres  de Mango en producción, dicha plantación tiene 8 años de edad y 0.50 has de limón en producción el cual lo cosecha semanalmente.  Complementariamente  Javier trabaja en un fundo agrícola el cual le genera ingresos adicionales. Cuenta con una experiencia de 5 años en el rubro de producción.

Para cada uno de los  productos de Javier, existe  un mercado fijo permanente, pues cuenta con clientes que esta muy contentos con los productos que Javier ofrece.

Javier solicita un crédito de  S/. 3,000.00 a Edpyme Alternativa para realizar las labores culturales de aplicación de fertilizante y agroquímicos. De esta manera se logrará una cosecha de buena calidad en el tiempo oportuno  y la cantidad que le soliciten, así crecer como empresario y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, a su familia.
 
Javier, es un cliente nuevo de Edpyme Alternativa, Javier sino ha manejado créditos con otro banco y presenta muy buen historial crediticio, lo cual da fe de su responsabilidad puntualidad y trabajo.
texts.en:
Javier is 42 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two young children. They own a home in the village of Cruce de Vega in the District of Tambogrande, Department of Piura, in northern Peru. Even though Javier lives in the rural section of the community, he still receives electricity.

He works as a farmer in order to support his household. Javier has two hectares of land of which one and a half hectares are devoted to mango production. He has been growing this crop for eight years. The remaining half hectare is devoted to producing lemons which are harvested each week. In addition, Javier works at a farming cooperative to generate additional income. He has five years of experience as a farmer.

Each of his products has an established market. He has customers who are very happy with the goods that he offers. Javier is requesting a loan of 3000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can complete farm tasks, such as applying fertilizers and chemicals. He hopes to achieve a good-quality harvest at the right time and in the appropriate amounts. Javier hopes to grow as an entrepreneur and provide his family a better quality of life.

He is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa. Javier has managed loans with another bank, so he presents a good credit history that indicates that he is responsible, prompt, and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Kalya

texts.en:
Kalya is 58, widowed and has seven children. Six of them are grown and live on their own and one son, according to the Kyrgyz tradition, lives with her and helps in the household. 

She started her business in breeding cattle and cultivating land with the initial capital of 6,000 KGS and manages to earn about 5,000 KGS in a month from selling milk and meat products.
  
Kalya has applied for a loan of 90,000 KGS to purchase bean seeds and mineral fertilizers. With the revenues, she plans to buy sheep, which will allow her to further broaden her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase seeds of beans and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 25 years old.  She is married and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Concepcion has a motorcycle transport rental business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month.  She has requested loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase an additional motorcycle for her business.

Concepcion is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she dreams of purchasing additional motorcycles to rent.

loans.use: purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Khaidav

texts.en:
Khaidav is 55 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They live in ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Khaidav is a monk. He established his own small monastery in 2004 and since then, he has been providing different religious services to his clients. Also he has a few disciples who come to his teachings every day. 

Khaidav's only son is mentally ill and needs constant care. Khaidav’s wife looks after and cares for his son. She also runs a home appliance retail business at the outdoor market. 

Khaidav’s monastery was built in 2004 and it needs some renovation at the moment. The loan Khaidav is taking will be used to buy the necessary building materials and to do renovation to his monastery.

loans.use: To buy the necessary building materials and to do renovation to his monastery.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana mujer emprendedora, trabajadora, honesta, madre soltera uno de sus hijos le ayudan económicamente, los otros están estudiando. Desde hace tiempo trabaja como conserje, tiene su proyecto de mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda poco a poco ir cambiando la madera por paredes de concreto,  con este préstamo seguirá realizándole cambio a la casa comprando materiales como: láminas, de zinc, golosa, perlines, bloques, cemento,. Para entechar la casa obteniendo seguridad, protección y comodidad.
texts.en: Ana is an enterprising, hard working, honest single mother.  One of her children helps her out economically; the others are still in school.  For some time now she’s been employed as a caretaker.  She has a home improvement project: to gradually replace the wood with concrete walls.  With this loan she will continue doing these changes to the house buying materials like: zinc metal sheets, screws, purlines, concrete blocks and cement to roof the house obtaining security, protection and comfort.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine‘s group is comprised of three hard-working young women. Christine is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Christine has a beauty salon, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay her school fees.  In the future, Christine hopes to become an accountant after her studies.

 Christine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business so she has enough capital which has helped her pay her school fees.

loans.use: to purchase braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco de 33 años, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicado en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Marco desde hace 3 años se dedica a la comercialización de animales como (cerdos, ovejas y aves de corral), los cría en sus corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento ideal, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades y gastos familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para compra de alimento balanceado, una vez que los engorde los comercializa a sus clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia. Marco con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo trata de salir adelante para seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia y brindarle a sus hijos mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Marco, age 33, lives with his wife and children in his own house.  The house does not have the basic services.  It is located in the rural zone of the Tambogrande district in the Piura department.  The zone is known for farming, livestock, and handicrafts.

Marco has been selling animals like pigs, sheep, and poultry for three years.  He raises them in corrals that he has behind his house.  He feeds them balanced feed, grains, and natural fodder.  Once they have acquired their ideal growth he sells them to his customers or at different markets in the area.  With the income he will be able to cover the family’s necessities and expenses.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy balanced feed.  Once he fattens the animals he sells them to his customers.  With the income he gets he will pay for the loan and improve his family’s standard of living.

With a lot of work and effort Marco tries to get ahead in order to continue helping his family financially and giving his children better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy balanced food to raise his animals.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (an orphan). 

Halima has a business of a cosmetics shop. She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Halima sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. 

Halima has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings, from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenge(s) for Halima include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and also to educate her children up to university level. Halima lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a determined businesswoman aged 39. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last six years, she has been managing a retail shop. She has employed two people to help her to run the business. In the next five years, she wants to expand the business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice and sugar. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en: Asteria is 58 years old, married, and has nine children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 8 years. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy nets and other fishing tools.  She would like to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing tools

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: Clotilde, de 57 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Adrián de 59 años y sus 03 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida, por ello se esmera diariamente. Ella proviene de una familia de cuya tradición familiar ha sido la agricultura, es así que trabaja sus tierras para que sean fertiles, es ahí donde siembra cacao y café, ya que estos productos tiene mayor demanda en el mercado. Es por ello que cuida de sus plantas de la plaga de insectos, ya que estos perjudicarían la cosecha. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio, pues es ahí donde vende sus productos. Este será su séptimo crédito de con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr comprar mallas y costales que le servirán para cuidar sus plantas de los insectos.
texts.en:
Clotilde, age 57, is a hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house with her 59 year old husband, Adrián, and their three beloved children.  What she wishes for the most is to give them a better quality of life.  That is why she does her best every day.

She comes from a family whose tradition has been agriculture.  That is why she works the land so that it will be fertile.  She grows cacao and coffee because these products are in greater demand at the market.  That is why she takes care of her plants so they are not affected by insect infestation, which would damage the harvest.

She has been doing this work for 20 years.  She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the gathering centers.  That is where she sells her products.

This will be her seventh loan with MFP.  She really wishes for a small support from all of you so that she can buy mesh and large sacks that she will use to keep her plants insect free.

loans.use: to buy mesh and large sacks.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат проживает в районе Хамадони. Ей 38 лет. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Саломат уже пять лет как занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном занимается торговлей золотых украшений. Кредит берет для приобретения новых видов золотых украшений.
texts.en: Salomat lives in the Hamadoni district.  She is 38 years old, divorced and has one child.  Salomat has been involved in retail sales at the market for five years.  She primarily sells gold jewelry.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of new types of gold jewelry.

loans.use: to purchase new varieties of gold jewelry

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and four children, who are still attending school. He has been involved in the construction field for the past 23 years. He is especially talented at completing wall foliage work (decorative finishing representing foliage). His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to help their families with their business income. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy construction materials which will help him be more efficient at work. In the future, he plans to work on bigger projects.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Mrs Oyunbileg, 42, sells leather gloves and eyeglasses in the market.  She rents a bulk and pays USD 350 for renting.  Since 2000 she has been doing her business non-stop and has gained a lot of experience in the selling business.  

She lives with her two sons and her husband in the suburban area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Recently the bulk renting cost has increased by over USD 100 on account of a high increase in inflation.  Due to this she needs to raise her business income, as well as expand it further.  She is planning to purchase a larger number of commodities from her suppliers from this month on according her plan.  The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchasing sales commodities such as leather gloves and eyeglasses to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase sales commodities such as leather gloves and eyeglasses to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with four children. 

Eva is peddling & selling banana cue & sweet potato cue (these are deep-fried and covered with caramelized brown sugar). She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. 

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nelly de 35 años, empezó con su tienda hace 4 años en un lugar donde no había una tienda bien surtida.

Gracias ha dios no ha tenido problemas con la delincuencia, solo con el polvo debido a las calles en las que vive no están pavimentadas.

En madre soltera con dos hijos (14 y 9 años) quien a podido sacar adelante con la ayuda de dios y el esfuerzo de cada día. Quiere comprar con el prestamo enlatados, bebidas, arroz etc. 

Su meta por alcanzar en poder tener una tienda mas grande y mas surtida; y poder lograr hacer la loza de su casa para poder vivir mas cómoda con sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Nelly, age 35, started her store four years ago in an area that did not have a well-stocked store.

Thanks to God, she has not had any problems with crime. Her only issue is the dust--the streets where she lives are not paved.

She is a single mother of two children (ages 14 and 9), and she has been able to get them ahead with God's help and her own hard work every day. She wants to use this loan to buy canned goods, drinks, rice, etc.

Her goal is to be able to have a bigger and better-stocked store, and to be able to put in a floor in her home in order for her and her children to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinks, rice, etc.

loans.name: Temirkhon

texts.ru: Темирхон имеет пятерых детей. Жена домохозяйка. Для содержания большой семьи приходится много трудиться. Дети взрослые и помогают отцу по работе. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов и откормом скота. На полученную прибыль хочет купить мебель для своего дома, чтобы создать удобства в семье.  Он имеет корм для скота от отходов выращенной сельхозкультуры. Он хотел бы получить займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки 3 голов крупного рогатого скота. Он благодарен вам за поддержку и великодушие.
texts.en: Temirkhon has five children. His wife is a home maker. To support such a large family Temirkhon works very hard. His older children also help him with his business. Temirkhon has a farm where he grows produce and raises cattle. Temirkhon feeds his animals leftovers from his fields. He is planning to use the loan to purchase three more calves for his herd. He will use profits from this loan to purchase furniture for his home, to make it more comfortable for his family. Temirkhon thanks you for your support and generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Zoila Silvana

texts.es:
La Señora. Zoila es socia del banco comunal El Mirador, vive por la parroquia de Turi, esta parroquia tiene el nombre de Mirador ya que desde allí se puede observar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales, se caracteriza por ser amables y gentiles con todos sus visitantes.

La Señora Zoila tiene 21 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos, su primer hijo tiene dos años de edad y su segundo hijo tiene 3 meses de edad. Su esposo es empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en la casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Ella se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos ya que aun son muy pequeños y en su casa se también se dedica a la cría de pollos.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su sexto crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de más pollos y en alimento para los mismos.

Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Zoila is a member of the El Mirador ["The Viewpoint"] communal bank.  She lives in the parish of Turi, which also has the name of Mirador as from here one can see a large part of the city of Cuenca.  Turi's population work in retailing, agriculture and raising animals, and are characterized by being friendly and kind to everyone who visits.

Señora Zoila is 21 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage.  She has two children; her older one is two years old, and her younger one is 3 months.  Her husband is employed privately. They do not have their own home, so they live her mom's house where they share in the household expenses.

Zoila works taking care of her children, as they are still very young.  She also works from her home raising chickens.

She is taking her sixth loan through the communal bank, and will invest it in purchasing more chickens and feed for them.

Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Victoria Eloisa

texts.es:
Victoria Eloisa tiene 48 años es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en el Recinto Las Blancas en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Ventanilla 26 DE NOVIEMBRE  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Victoria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul realiza las compras de sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado de Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos como urea, insecticidas entre los más usados  para el cuidado de los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos de la familia y para invertir en la siembra en semillas e insumos.  Su sueño es viajar a Europa, tener una casa y que los hijos terminen los estudios.

En los tiempos libres disfruta mucho escuchar música.
texts.en:
Victoria Eloisa is 48 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and children in the Las Blancas settlement in the Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province. 

This community bank is called "26 de Noviembre" and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton. The members of the communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Victoia is a farmer, and she grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She buys her products in Ventanas, and and she sells her products in the market in Ventanas.

The requested loan is to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure like urea and, insecticides, which are what she uses the most to take care of her crops.  

The loan has helped her increase the family income.  It is also used for planting the seeds and for supplies.

Her dream is to travel to Europe, have a house, and that her children complete their education.

In her free time she really enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure like urea and, insecticides.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad se dedica a la compra y venta de muebles de segunda mano, para esta actividad ella cuenta con un puesto ubicado en la populosa zona de la feria de El Alto,  la Paz-Bolivia. Las compras las realiza en las zonas de más alto nivel de vida como las de Sopocachi, zona sur de la paz.  Los muebles de segunda mano son muy cotizados en la ciudad del Alto por tener en su mayoría población de muy bajos recursos. Con el dinero del crédito comprara muebles, para luego ponerlos a la venta después de darle una arregladita. El sueño de la señora felicidad es el de llegar a tener su casa propia y así ofrecer a sus 3  hijos una mejor condición de vida, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es la única actividad con la que sostiene a su familia por ser su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Felicidad buys and sells secondhand furniture. She has a stand for this activity located in the populous market area of El Alto, La Paz, Bolivia. She makes her purchases in the areas with the highest standard of living, such as Sopocachi and the southern area of La Paz. Secondhand furniture is very popular in the city of El Alto because the majority of its population has very few resources. With the money from the loan, she will buy furniture, which she will then sell after fixing up a bit. Felicidad's dream is to have her own house and thus offer her three children better living conditions. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her, since this is the only activity with which she sustains her family, as she is the family's only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Malang

texts.fr: Malang est directeur d'une école privée de trois classes,la petite session la moyenne session et la grande session pour un nombre de 185 élèves.Il est âgé de 47 ans,il capitalise une expérience 16 ans,père d'un enfant qui fait la 1ere au collège.Malang démarre sa journée de 8h à 13h du lundi au vendredi,il sollicite un crédit 400 000f pour la réfection de la toiture de son école.Avec son travail,il assure toutes les charges de son école et de sa petite famille,les frais scolaires de son enfant.Il a comme projet futur,la création de 2 classes élémentaire dans son établissement.

loans.use: ENTRETIEN DE LA TOITURE DU BATIMENT DE L'ECOLE

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 35 years old. She is married with three children aged between 3 and 6 years, all of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been farming for the past 5 years. With the loan from kiva, she would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Rince

texts.en: Rince is a 41 year old woman, is married to Simon (52) and has 5 children. Simon is a village officer with a small salary, therefore Rince initiated a selling cakes business 2 years ago to help her pay for her 1st child tuition fees as well as the other children. In order to increase the amount of cakes she sells as well the business income, Rince joined with another member and get loan from TLM of amounting IDR 2,000,000. This business would help Rince to pay for more cakes ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, and also kitchen utilities such as wok, spatula, stove etc. With the help of TLM, Rince will no longer sell cakes door to door however, she would like to sell it in front of her house. She is hoping that the business will grow well so she can pay the loan to TLM right on time.

loans.use: to pay for more cakes ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, and also kitchen utilities such as wok, spatula, stove etc.

loans.name: Mosompa Kapita

texts.en:
Masompa is married with six dependants .she did not have formal education though she was able to educate her children by keeping dairy cows. She is a devoted   Christian and a member of Ack church Mothers Union. She is the chairlady of the group.

She started by buying two dairy cows when given a Mifugo loan by WEEC in 2001.she later started Zero grazing. Today her Dairy cows produce enough milk to be consumed at home and twenty litres to be sold to local hotels. Her Dairy farming business enables her to educate her children.

loans.use: If a loan of USD.900 is given to her, she will be in a position to buy two more Dairy cows and a steer, thus increasing milk production as well as income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND HIS SECOND HAND CLOTHING BUSINESS

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Mrs. Victoria O. is a 47-year-old woman. She is happily married with six children. She is delighted in engaging in the sale of food items, and is optimistic that her business will improve with the help of her USD400 loan.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell

loans.name: Abdul Sabor

texts.en:
A. Sabor lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has the responsibility for supporting his family because his father and mother died in an explosion in Kabul 4 years ago. He is the youngest of his brothers.

He sells cosmetics on the street in the city. He took his 5th cycle group loan and bought shirts, clothes for children, and some extra things and is doing a good business. He wants to take anther loan to rent a shop and expand his business to support his family better than now. He would like to thank AFSG for helping him.

loans.use: To rent a shop

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.es:
Genoveva M. has three children and has been a part of Pro Mujer for one year. She owns a boutique that specializes in the tailoring and sale of women's clothing. Genoveva has been in this business for 18 years now and has thus acquired a lot of experience. She needs a loan so that she can purchase material and merchandise in time for the end of the year parties. The store in which her boutique is located is also for rent, which decreases her revenues. Consequently, she requires a loan so that she can expand her business, both in terms of pure materials and in terms of its products.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Genoveva M., soltera, tiene 3 hijos y es socia de Pro Mujer hace 1 año y es propietaria de una boutique en la calle Alfonso Ugarte, en plena Feria 16 de Julio. Su especialidad es la confección y venta de prendas femeninas, como ser vestidos y trajes. Son 18 años que Genoveva se encuentra en el negocio de la confección, y con la experiencia adquirida, necesita de inversión de capital con el fin de proveer de material y mercadería su tienda para las fiestas de fin de año. Actualmente la tienda donde funciona su boutique se encuentra en alquiler, por tanto esto merma cuantiosamente sus ingresos. Ella necesita dinero para poder ampliar su mercadería, tanto en material como en productos.

loans.use: Material and Merchandise Purchasing

loans.name: Sandra Janeth

texts.es:
I am a traveling saleswoman and I sell in the streets and also in my home. I have 5 years of experience in sales and thank God I am doing good. My sales usually increase during the Christmas season and I already have various orders from my customers. I wouldn't like to decieve my customers. I am a single mother of 2 children and I support my family with this business.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Yo soy vendedora ambulante, yo vendo en las calles y tambien en mi casa. Tengo 5 años de dedicarme a las ventas, Gracias a Dios me ha ido bien. Ahora biene la temporada davideña las ventas se me ingrementan. Tengo varios pdidos de mis clientes y no me gustaria fallarles.Soy madre soltera de 2 hijos con este negocio mantengo a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for men and woman

loans.name: Foketi

texts.en: Foketi F. is 33 years old, married with four kids. She applied this loan in order to buy supplies for her bingo business. She runs the bingo two nights per week and she can make 420 Tala ($160 USD) per night. Foketi  is thinking of running the bingo three times a week if possible. She plans to use her next loan to attract more clients. She is very happy with her business and she is thankful for the help she gets from the loan program.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her bingo business

loans.name: Jessica Jackelin

texts.es:
Jessica is 30 years old and has two children who attend school and depend on her. They live in Asentamiento Humano in the district of Salaverry in the Trujillo provence. She has set up a small shop in her house where she sells grocery items, vegetables, sodas and beers. She buys all of her products in a wholesale market in Trujillo where she gets lower prices and therefore higher profits on her sales. Jessica is a member of the communal bank Las Auroras en Accion, from whom she received her first loan to buy phone cards and kitchen utensils. With the new loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy more grocery items and vegetables, as well as beer in cases. Her dream is to have a car so she can avoid the high costs of transporting her merchandise.

La señora Jessica tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta el cuarto año de secundaria. Tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar que aun dependen de ella. Vive en el Asentamiento Humano “Aurora Díaz” del Distrito de Salaverry en la Provincia de Trujillo del Departamento de La Libertad. Ha ambientado la sala de su casa para poner una pequeña tienda en la que vende abarrotes, verduras, cerveza y gaseosas. Todos los productos que vende los compra en un mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Trujillo porque consigue los productos a menor precio lo que le permite tener mayor margen de utilidad. La señora Jessica es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción”, en este Banco Comunal obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/.300 soles, con los que compró tarjetas telefónicas y utensilios de cocina, que la mayoría de madres de familia de su sector le hicieron pedidos. Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 soles, que cancelará en 4 meses, comprará algo de abarrotes y verduras, además 50 cajas de cerveza. La señora Jessica sueña con tener un carro para poder movilizarse sobre todo a realizar sus compras en Trujillo y evitar incurrir en gastos de transporte.

loans.use: TO STOCK HER SMALL STORE WITH VARIOUS ITEMS, INCLUDING GROCERIES AND VEGETABLES

loans.name: Omowumi

texts.en:
Omowumi A. is 42 years old, happily married and has 2 children. She comes from Shibiri in Lagos State, Nigeria.

She sells wine and soft drinks and has been in business since 1999. She's requesting a loan of $450 to buy more wine and soft drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more wine and soft drinks for sale

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en: Priscilla E. N. is married with 3 children, is 35 years old, and hails from Shibiri, Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells rechargeable cards and makes calls for people. She has been in this business since 2006 and needs a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more rechargeable cards for sales.

loans.use: To buy more rechargeable cards for sales

loans.name: Carmela Filomena

texts.es:
Carmela, 42, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She finished 5 years of high school. She has four children but only two still live with her. She earns a living selling Esika beauty products-- fragrances, jewelry, powders, deodorants, etc--which she buys at a discount (only available to saleswomen),and then sells. She's been selling this line of products for many years after switching from Avon products which aren't well known here.

She belongs to the Santa Lucia community lending group from which she received her first loan of S/.300. With the first loan, she bought various products. With this loan of S/.500, to be repaid in four months, she will buy colognes, powders, shampoo and jewelry. Her greatest wish is to have a market stall in the city of Trujillo where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Carmela Filomena Olguín A. vive en el distrito de Moche en la provincia de Trujillo en el departamento La Libertad - Perú, tiene 42 años de edad. Estudio hasta el quinto año de secundaria, tiene cuatro hijos pero solo dos aun dependen de ella. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza de la línea de productos “esika” el cual compra a precio de consejera (precio solo para vendedoras) fragancias, joyas, talcos, desodorantes, etc. para tener en stock. Hace muchos años que vende éstos productos, empezó con la línea de “avon” no tenia muchos pedidos debido a que no es muy conocido es por eso que se cambio a la línea que actualmente pertenece.

Ella integra el Grupo Mientras Tanto “Santa Lucia” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 con el cual compró varios productos. Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 que cancelará en cuatro meses comprara colonias, talcos, champú y joyas. Su mayor sueño es tener un stand en la ciudad de Trujillo para vender sus productos.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Yvon Mireyna

texts.es:
Ms. Yvon Mireyna U. M. is 24 years old, she studied but didn’t finish her major because of personal reasons. She has 2 children that depend on her. She lives in Saupice en in the district of Paijan in the province of Ascope in the state of La Libertad – Peru. When Ms. Yvon began her business she did it selling beauty products, she would offer and sell to her friends. Sometimes she wasn’t able to pay by the date and bit by bit she lost her merchandise and didn’t make enough income to be able to buy more. Some of her clients suggested that she sell clothing for women, men and children. She is a member of the United Hands communal bank where she obtained her first loan of S. 300.00 this money was invested in the purchase of beauty products to have in stock. With the loan of S. 1500.00 which she will pay off in 6 months, she will purchase goods for different requests: school shoes, skirts, jeans, school shirts, clothes for children, jewelry, pants, and blouses. Ms. Yvon’s biggest dream is to construct her home and have a place where she can sell all her products.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Yvon Mireyna U. M. tiene 24 años de edad, estudio superior pero no termino la carrera de secretariado por motivos personales. Tiene dos hijos que aun dependen de ella.Vive en Saucipe en el distrito de Paiján en la provincia de Ascope en el departamento La Libertad – Perú. Cuando la señora Yvon empezó su negocio lo hizo vendiendo productos de belleza, ofrecía y vendía a sus conocidos y amistades. En oportunidades no le cancelaban en la fecha y poco a poco se iba descapitalizando y no ganaba lo suficiente así que dejo de vender. Algunos de los clientes que había conseguido le sugirieron que venda ropa para dama, caballero y niños, en general los pedidos que le hicieran. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas” lugar donde obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 este dinero lo invirtió para comprar productos de belleza para tener en stock. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 el cual pagara en seis meses comprará diferentes pedidos que le han solicitado: zapatos de colegio, faldas Jean, camisas de colegio, ropa para niño, joyas de fantasía, pantalones Jean y blusas. La señora Yvon es fiscal de su Banco Comunal. Su mayor sueño es construir su casa y ambientar un lugar donde venda todos sus productos.

loans.use: With the loan she will purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothing inventory and increase her sales volume

loans.name: Zaynab

texts.ru:
Zaynab S. lives in the Gissar area. For eight years she has been engaged in the trading of clothes. Except for clothing trade, Zaynab is engaged in the tailoring of bed-clothes and sells them from her shop. Currently she is experiencing financial difficulties. Therefore she wishes to receive a loan to buy fabric for tailoring bed-clothes. She plans to extinguish the loan within 12 months. Zaynab lives with her family and is married with four children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Сафарова Зайнаб проживает в Гиссарском районе. Уже восемь лет как занимается торговлей одежды. Кроме того занимается пошивом постельного белья и продает со своей торговой точки. Сейчас возникли финансовые проблемы . Поэтому она хочет получить кредит и закупить ситец для пошива постельного белья. Погасить кредит она планирует в течении 12 месяцев. Живет со своей семьей. Зайнаб замужем и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Aissatou

texts.fr:
Aissatou B., whom everyone calls Amicollé, is the manager of a health cooperative. Concurrently, she runs a shop out of her home, which she has entrusted to her sister. Her business hinges on the retail sale of livestock feed, including millet, maize, and sorghum. With this loan she hopes to increase her inventory in order to maximize profits during the rainy season.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Aissatou B. dite, amicollé, est gérante d'une mutuelle de santé. Paralèlement, elle a un magasin chez elle qu'elle a confié à sa soeur. Son commerce est axé sur la vente au détail d'aliments de bétail, notamment le mil, le mais, le sorgho. Avec ce pret elle compte renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de tirer le maximum de profit durant l'hivernage.

loans.use: Sale of Livestock Feed

loans.name: Neria

texts.es:
Mrs. Neria belongs to the “Las Azucenas II” Communal Bank located at AA.HH Fernando Belaunde Street Lino Velázquez Mzc. Lt.2, in the Yarina Cocha District, Department of Ucayali. She is 42 years old, has a daughter, and counts on the support of her husband. She decided to invest in a moto-car to use as a taxi with the first loan of 300 soles ($125) that she received from Manuela Ramos. Currently a driver drives the moto-car, but she administers all the income and expenses for the vehicle, although when it comes to mechanical things she does not understand. Despite this, she benefits from the vehicle and is thinking about buying another similar vehicle. With this loan of 1,200 soles ($425), which she will repay over 5 months, she will maintain the vehicle, as it needs some spare parts. Neria is happy with Manuela Ramos because it gave her the opportunity to buy her moto-car and manage it well, and her husband values his wife’s initiative. He has suggested that he be the driver and she be the administrator. Neria is thankful for this opportunity.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Neria, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Azucenas II, ubicado en el AA.HH Fernando Belaunde Jr. Lino Velázquez Mzc Lt.2, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha, del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años es madre de 1 una hija, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en un vehículo(motocard) para transporte Publico. En estos momentos su vehículo lo maneja un chofer, pero ella esa administrando todo los ingresos y gastos que le ocasiona el vehículo, aunque cuando se trata de mecánica muchas cosas no entiende, a pesar de ello esta obteniendo beneficios y esta pensando comprar otro vehículo similar. Con este préstamo recibido de S/ 1.200 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, dará mantenimiento del vehículo, que ya necesita cambiar algunos repuestos. Neria esta feliz con Manuela Ramos por que le dio la oportunidad de poder comprarse su motokar y poder administrarlo bien y su esposo valora la iniciativa de su esposa. El le propuso ser el chofer y ella la administradora. Neria da gracias por esta oportunidad que se le dio.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S. is 33 and works as a carpenter. He lives with his wife in Siem Reap. She earns around US$5 each day selling groceries to support their family. Their three children are currently students. Mr. Seng is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more wood for his carpentry as well as move towards his wife's future plan to expand her grocery store.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for his carpentry.

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en:
Mtumwa has had her own bakery in Zanzibar since 2002. There she bakes breads and other local baked goods for the people all over the Kikwajuni borough. She bakes from 7:00am to 2:00pm daily and is able to make a profit of approximately $30 each month. She is hoping that this loan allows her to buy more ingredients so that she can prepare more bread each month.

Mtumwa is 30 years old, married, and has one 4-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake breads.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christiana A. is 30 years old, and she is the mother of two children: one child has completed senior high school, while the other is still in school. She is very hard-working, and the income she generates from her business is critical to her family's well-being. More specifically, she trades in charcoal in her neighborhood. Charcoal, she explains, is a very popular source of energy for cooking purposes in nearly every Ghanaian home. Christiana obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Jamani in the Eastern region of Ghana (where she lives), and she sells such charcoal at retail prices to her customers.

Now, she is requesting a loan to buy charcoal in bulk to thereby increase her inventory of charcoal. Moreover, she hopes that the loan proceeds will enable her to increase her savings in order to pay for her children’s school fees.

Christiana is a member of the community group known as the Knowledge Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each others' loans as social collateral to ensure that their respective loans are promptly repaid. Her picture was taken at one of her group's meetings.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing charcoal in bulk

loans.name: I

texts.en:
I R. is 52 years old. She has been growing rice since 1986. She is widowed with nine children, two of whom are married.

With a large family, I R. works hard everyday to care for her children. Three of her sons help to earn income to support the family. One son runs a motorcycle repair business near his house. His business is growing, and I R. needs a loan to purchase more materials for his repair service and to buy gasoline to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to repair motocycles and gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso tiene 38 años esta casado con la señora Maria de G., tienen tres hijos menores, vive en casa propia y hace 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Con su trabajo logro progresar mucho ya que tiene una hermosa casa, una camioneta y una moto. Gracias a su trabajo hoy día da empleo a 5 personas quienes le ayudan en la venta y cobranza de sus más de 600  tarjetas de clientes.
Su idea es seguir creciendo para que sus hijos logren una educación superior.
texts.en:
Señor Alfonso is 38 years old. He is married to Maria de G.. They have three young children and live in their own home. They have been dedicated to this activity for 10 years. With his work he has progressed a lot and now has a beautiful house, a small truck and a motorcycle. Thanks to his work he now employs 5 people who help him with sales and the collection of their more than 600 client accounts. He wants to continue growing so that their children can have a higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as sheets, towels, comforters, bedspreads, curtains, jeans, t-shirts, household utensils and other things.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es: En su casa alquilada, Ayde de 19 años, compra toda la chatarra que puede para luego venderla, es soltera así que trabaja sola. Rodeada de artefactos viejos, los cuales espera vender, Ayde comienza su día en la “cachina” (mercado de cosas usadas), ofrece diversos artículos a las personas que pasan, pero disfruta más cuando logra venderlas y es que su alegría hace que sea una de las mejores vendedoras de la cachina. Ayde sufre mucho trasladando la pesada chatarra hasta su negocio, pero aun así, ya lleva un año sacrificándose para mejorar su futuro. Como Ayde pudo pagar con mucha facilidad su primer préstamo con MFP, decidió solicitar este segundo crédito que sabe también pagara a tiempo. Con la cantidad requerida comprará más chatarra, para tener más cosas que ofrecer a la gente que compra en la cachina.
texts.en:
From her rented house, Ayde, 19 years old, buys all the scraps she can to later sell. She is single, and therefore works on her own. Surrounded by old artifacts which she hopes to sell, Ayde starts her day at the “cachina” (used goods market) offering her various items to passersby. She enjoys it the most when she manages to sell something, and her happiness makes her one of the best salespeople at the cachina. Ayde suffers a great deal transporting her second-hand wares to her place of business and, despite this hardship, she has spent a year so far sacrificing to improve her future. Since Ayde was easily able to repay her first loan with MFP, she decided to request this second loan that she knows she will also pay back on time. With the amount she is requesting, she will buy more used goods to have more to offer the people who come to buy at the cachina.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi K. est une jeune femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse depuis 5 ans de sodabi (une liqueur locale) et des produits divers. Elle espère avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise en payant plus de marchandises pour la revente.
texts.en:
Afi K. is a young woman, 42 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. For the last 5 years, she has been a reseller of a local liquor called sodabi along with various other products. She is hoping with this loan to increase her business by purchasing additional supplies for resale.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.en:
Amriddin is married and has 5 children. Due to the lack of jobs in his town, Dushanbe, Tajikistan, to provide for his family Amriddin started his own business selling sewing machines and supplies (needle, thread, and other small items) about 14 years ago. He has become well-known in his town, and his sales have increased. To continue growing his business, Amriddin is requesting a loan in the amount of $1300 to purchase more merchandise to offer customers greater variety and quality of products and to provide better customer service. He commits to repaying this loan within 12 months. Be part of this business and support Amriddin. He and his family thank you very much!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; its role in ending Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous cultural figures, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, Tajikistan is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, modern Western culture, and Central Asian traditions. Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war that began soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged Tajikistan's already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition to potential lenders. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine and supplies for it.

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en: Chinyere, 41 years old and married with four children, has a poultry farm where she raises birds to sell. In this business for a long time, she is now requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more poultry to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to sell

loans.name: Teu

texts.en: Teu F., 28, is married with three children. She has four years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public three days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Teu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy equipment and chemicals for her business, as well as home improvements.

loans.use: Purchase garden spray, bush knife, and chemicals

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza
Vilma es casada, tiene 40 años y 1 hija, Vilma y hermanos integran una asociación propietaria de un Colegio llamado Raúl P. en el que se imparte el nivel primario, secundario y el no escolarizado, Vilma es la directora administrativa del Colegio. Vilma tiene proyectado tener un colegio de su propiedad.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de buzos y uniformes.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener un colegio de su propiedad y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the collective Banco Comunal Alianza. She is 40 years old, married, and has one daughter. Vilma and her siblings run a school association called Raúl P., which teaches K-12 grades as well as non-graded studies. Vilma is the administrative director of the school. Vilma needs a loan of 3500 soles to buy sweatshirts and uniforms. Vilma's dreams include having her own school and building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweatshirts and uniforms.

loans.name: Elda Eile

texts.es:
ELDA EILY P. N., pertenece al Banco Comunal “DAMAS DEL ORIENTE” con domicilio en el Jr. LOS NARANJOS  N° 180 del distrito de MANANTAY, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo que aun esta estudiando.  Ssu esposo está haciendo servicio  militar en Lima.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio, no cuenta con un local donde vender.  La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, hace 2 año, con este dinero compró algunas prendas mas y afianzo su negocio. Su esposo la ayuda con el negocio, él es el que le envía mercadería desde Lima. 

Con este  préstamo  de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra de 2 docenas de zapatos, 3 paquetes de polos y pantalones.

En el poco tiempo que esta con Manuela Ramos se siente contenta, por la ayuda que Manuela Ramos da a las mujeres para salir adelante, ayudar a su esposo e hijos, y en la economía del hogar.
texts.en:
Elda Eily P. N. belongs to the Community Bank "Damas del Oriente" (Ladies of the Orient) located at Los Naranjos Number 180 of the district of Manantay. She is 30 years old and has a son that is still in school. Her husband is in military service in Lima. She makes a living selling clothing door to door, she does not have a space from which to sell. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, two years ago. She bought some more outfits and capitalized her business. Her husband helps her with the business by sending her merchandise from Lima. With this loan of 1,200 new soles, she will purchase 2 dozens pairs of shoes, 3 packages of shirts and pants. During the short time that she has been with Manuela Ramos, she has felt happy with the help that Manuela Ramos gives to the women in getting ahead, helping their husbands and children and economics of running a home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose N. is a 45-year-old businesswoman who has operated a retail business for six years. She has three children who attend school. She is requesting a loan to purchase more retail items such as boxes of Safi drinks, packets of sweets, tomato sauce and cooking oil to expand her business. Thanks to her business, she obtained a beautiful house. Her dream is to educate her children abroad.

loans.use: To purchase more items to expand her retail business.

loans.name: Tulagatasi

texts.en: Tulagatasi A., 38, is married and has 7 children. She has experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public and people of the village 4 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~ 90 USD). SPBD loans are Tulagatasi’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a knapsack, sprayer, chemicals, knives, spade, chainsaw.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora O. sells provisions. She is 50 years old and married with eight children. She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Lealofi

texts.en:
Lealofi L. (0) is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Vaovai. She is married and has six adult children.

Lealofi owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 380 WST a month.

In 2008, Lealofi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

Lealofi is now requesting a new loan of 1,250 WST which will again be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 52 years old and married with 7 children. She has a bore hole for commercial purpose and also rent out cooking utensils for ceremonies. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100000 to purchase a generator for power supply. This will alternate for electricity for the pumping machine. She thanks you for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a generator

loans.name: Romao Luis

texts.pt:
Romão Luis B. nasceu na provincial de inahmbane no distrito de Zavala, tem 45 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos com idades compreendidos entre 16 e 22 anos dois dos quais freqüentam escola. Estudou ate 7 classe tendo parado para começar a trabalhar ainda muito cedo devido à falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. Vivem com a esposa, filhos e enteada na casa própria no distrito de boane. 

Mudou se de inhambane para maputo em casa dos tios no ano de 1981, sozinho, com intuito de encontrar melhores condições de vida. Logo conseguiu emprego e casou se no ano de 1992. Neste momento é funcionário do estado desempenhando as funções de dactilografo há mais de 23 anos. Recebe mensalmente 2.895,00MT, como salário. Aplica no sustento da família, construção da casa e pagamento de credito.

A esposa faz trabalhos caseiros. Este é o terceiro empréstimo do Romão com a instituição no valor de 10.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, barrotes e outros materiais) de uma casa de alvenaria.
Os primeiros créditos foram para o mesmo propósito nos valores de 3.000,00MT e 6.000,00MT, respectivamente.

Nunca tinha recebido credito em outros bancos e propõe se a pagar o presente empréstimo, tal como os outros passados, sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos. Sonha ver a casa finalizada.
texts.en:
Romão Luis B. was born in Inahmbane in the district of Zavale. He is 45 years old, married and a father of three children between the ages 16 and 22, two of them students. He finished 7th grade but had to drop school to start working and help his parents. He lives with his wife, children and stepdaughter at their house in the district of Boane. He left Inhambane for Maputo in 1981 and lived with his uncle and aunt, trying to find better life conditions. Soon after that he got a job and got married in 1992. He's been working as a typist for over 23 years, and makes 2.895,00 (about U$105) per month. With this money he supports his family, builds his house and pays loans. This is Romão's third loan, in the amount of $375, which he'll use to buy construction supplies. His first loans were for the same purpose, in the amounts of $110 and $220. He's committed to pay this loan like he's paid the ones in the past. He dreams of seeing his house finished.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (concrete, rock, sand)

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena L. is from the village of Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 57 years old, widowed and has three grown children. Nena has owned and operated a retail shop, specializing in green bananas and daily essentials, for over 15 years. As her main source of income, the business generates approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nena joined HSPFI to access their financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
